description: PERSONAGRAPH IS HIRING!  DATA ENGINEER  Location: Sunnyvale, California  Term: Full-time  Website: www.personagraph.com  Job description: We are looking for talented, hard-working Data Engineers to join our rapidly expanding team. Personagraph has engineered the first brand focused audience data platform for mobile apps. We empower brands, agencies and publishers with actionable audience understanding, segmentation, and targeting based on core demographics, intent, and interest.  Our Data Engineers will process and analyze terabytes of data for more than 250 million users (and growing) within Personagraph’s Pipeline team. You will work with cutting edge Big Data technologies and apply Machine Learning algorithms to understand our users’ behavior. You will frequently switch between different technologies such as Hadoop, AeroSpike, Spark, Elasticsearch, Nodejs, Python, Java, Javascript, Scala and others.  The Data Engineer will contribute to Personagraph’s success by:  supporting the Data Scientist team and translating proof of concept into code that can be run in production environment  applying machine learning algorithms and to understand user’s behavior  working with the QA team and troubleshoot any issues that may arise during production  The Data Engineer should possess these skills: BS in Computer Science or related fields  around 2 years of Object Oriented Design experience working on backend systems  experience working with and evaluating open source technologies and demonstrated ability to make objective choices  some experience working with Big Data and NoSQL technologies like Hadoop, Storm, or Spark  around 1-2 years of experience in Java or Python  strong interest in Statistics, Probability Theory, Natural Language Processing, Data Mining, Recommendation Systems or Probability/Optimization Algorithms  strong interest in Data Science and learning how to make sense of massive amounts of unstructured data  Personagraph has developed the most scalable and effective real time, programmatic audience platform for mobile video advertising. We are a true, mobile first data and media company designed to deliver best of breed audience targeting and delivery solutions for Global Fortune 500 companies & their Agencies. Find out more at www.personagraph.com  Come work with us and enjoy competitive compensation, medical benefits, 401k, PTO, catered food, drinks, gym and lot of opportunity to grow and have fun.  Personagraph is a subsidiary of Intertrust Technologies Corporation . We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and e-Verified.

description: Additional Location(s) or Information: Guadalajara, Mexico Job Category: Supply Chain Operations Level of Experience: Experienced - Non Manager  Requisition #: R1008167 Description: The Business Entity Cisco Supply Chain Operations is committed to achieving intimacy with our customers and channel partners on a global basis.  The Team The Customer Excellence Data Scientist will be responsible for developing the tools and analytics capabilities required to provide customer insight that will drive Supply Chain’s efforts to increase Customer and Partner Satisfaction. This role is responsible for the development and continuous improvement of Cisco’s customer understanding using multiple tools including text based analytics tools, and data visualization tools. This is a high profile position that has direct impact to the customer experience, and supply chain operations.  Role & Responsibilities  Designs, develops and programs methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze multi-unstructured, diverse “big data” and traditional enterprise data sources to generate actionable insights, predictive models and solutions for customer insight Develops and codes software programs, algorithms and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources Performs feasibility studies to identify meaningful insights from data and metadata sources; interprets and communicates insights and findings from analysis and experiments to business managers Drives better decision making and business values through obtaining predictive and actionable insight Supports critical business requirements by creating sophisticated methods of mining data for patterns and leverage predictive analytics model that can be turned into business values  Minimum Qualifications  Ability to convert a Business Problem into Analytical problem and providing Analytical Solutions Data Visualization: Effective communication of data through visual means through proper techniques Data Analytics: Ability to conduct unstructured analysis of both small and large data to discover areas of interest for problem analysis and recommendation based on the results Predictive Analytics: The ability to construct Markov chains into self learning Neural networks in order to predict likely future performance outcomes, as correlated to current expectations Analytical Modeling: Building the equivalent of computer programs, taking either real or generated data to solve analytical problems Functional: The ability to lay common sense and actual business wisdom over the top of the resulting analyses specific to the business function to guide the recommendation Communication: Excellent communication and collaboration skills; the ability to distill complexity and present and explain the data and insights in simple and easy-to-understand business terms  Desired Skills  Experience with Text analytics software  About Cisco The Internet of Everything is a phenomenon driving new opportunities for Cisco and it's transforming our customers' businesses worldwide. We are pioneers and have been since the early days of connectivity. Today, we are building teams that are expanding our technology solutions in the mobile, cloud, security, IT, and big data spaces, including software and consulting services. As Cisco delivers the network that powers the Internet, we are connecting the unconnected. Imagine creating unprecedented disruption. Your revolutionary ideas will impact everything from retail, healthcare, and entertainment, to public and private sectors, and far beyond. Collaborate with like-minded innovators in a fun and flexible culture that has earned Cisco global recognition as a Great Place To Work. With roughly 10 billion connected things in the world now and over 50 billion estimated in the future, your career has exponential possibilities at Cisco.  Watch Video To Learn More About Cisco  Customer Satisfaction, Data Scientist, Business Intelligence, Predictive analytics, Text Analytics, Supply Chain Job Type: Experienced Opportunity Category: *None

description: It's no accident that Netflix provides one of the smoothest and best-integrated streaming video experiences across the hundreds of devices we support. Netflix takes its data seriously and leverages it as part of our core culture to make data-driven decisions to steer product development, and we've only scratched the surface in the types of deeper analytics we'd like to do!  Want to help? We're looking for a manager to work directly with the streaming client engineering teams to lead a team that drives data and analytics regarding the usage, landscape, quality and performance of the streaming experience. Your stakeholders will include the teams that develop the video playback platform, specific client implementations (computer, game console and mobile clients, etc.), as well as cross-platform initiatives such as client security and device resilience.  What You Will Do  Lead a team of data engineers, analysts and scientists to provide full analytic support for the Netflix streaming client engineering teams Further grow this team by having a direct hand in identifying and recruiting top talent in the industry Take a hands-on role in helping to design and develop architectures for richer, faster and easier data access Be a thought leader in new types of analytics we can do on behalf of our stakeholders Ensure we maintain a high degree of reliability and accuracy in the data and metrics we publish Collaborate with other leaders to evolve the effectiveness of the larger Streaming Analytics team Look for ways to improve communication and knowledge sharing with peer analytic teams Help to build Netflix's external brand in the data space by speaking at conferences, writing blog posts and thinking of new ways to share the innovative work we're doing in data and analytics  Who You Are (Essential): 10 years of experience in a mixture of software engineering, data engineering and analytics 3 years experience leading a highly technical team in a dynamic environment Impressive track record of being able to deliver on complex projects, solid project management skills and attention to detail Hands-on experience in architecting and developing data processing and warehouse systems Exceptional communication skills Flexibility and comfort working in a dynamic organization with minimal documentation and process Experience with distributed analytic processing technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Presto, MapReduce, Kafka, Spark, etc) Experience across different database platforms, including MPP ones such as Teradata and Redshift and/or newer scalable stores such as Druid and ElasticSearch Comfort with software development methodology and expertise in one or more programming languages (Java preferred, but C/C++ and/or Python are good too)  Who You Are (Preferred): Experience in real-time data processing Experience with consumer-facing internet products and services Experience with analytical tools supporting data analysis and reporting (MicroStrategy, Tableau, etc) Solid foundation in statistical analysis Computer networking background Familiarity with how streaming media works under the covers

description: PURPOSE OF POSITION: Cancer Prevention Institute of California (CPIC) is dedicated to preventing Cancer before it begins. We continue to be a leader in initiating innovative research programs to understand the path of cancer through distinct populations. We share our expertise by partnering with independent scientists, academic institutions, and health organizations, including a formal partnership with the Stanford University Cancer Center, in the United States and around the world.  We are excited to announce we are looking for an Oncology Data Specialist without a Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) to join our Registry Operations Unit. This position is full-time and will work at our Headquarters in Fremont, California. The Oncology Data Specialist without CTR will be able to perform a wide variety of registry functions which includes technical duties related to identifying , abstracting , coding cancer cases and other reportable diseases from designated facilities and physician offices in the Greater Bay Area.  We are looking for someone with strong attention to detail , excellent interpersonal skills , and a team player . Are you interested in joining the team? If so, please apply below. We hope you will visit our website to find out why CPIC could offer exactly what you are looking for in your ODS role!  PRINCIPAL DUTIES: 1. Performs several routine casefinding procedures necessary to identify every cancer patient with a reportable diagnosis or for targeted patients involved in Rapid Case Ascertainment (RCA) and Special Studies. This includes review of electronic and paper pathology reports, consolidating tumor reports from multiple reporting sources, linkage resolution and updating of the casefinding data base.  2. Works closely with other Oncology Data Specialists to coordinate the work flow for various routine data collections tasks in designated facilities and counties.  3. Applies follow-up data to the CCR DMS database as needed and resolves linkage discrepancies as needed.  4. Reviews and resolves case-matching reports generated by the casefinding linkage program.  5. Abstracts and codes information, under the supervision of a certified tumor registrar (CTR), from a variety of reporting sources, including hospitals, physician offices, radiation facilities, death certificates, pathology departments, patterns of care studies and other special studies utilizing current guidelines from registry standard-setting organizations.  6. Assists with overall implementation of electronic pathology reporting as assigned, including initial quality control to ensure completeness and accuracy of electronic reporting.  7. Establishes and maintains effective, cooperative, and tactful working relationships with medical facility personnel. Organizes work and workloads to balance the needs and requirements of the Registry.  8. P e rforms other duties as required, including participation and attendance at appropriate meetings and training events.  QUALIFICATIONS: Requires two years of progressively responsible experience in the medical field processing medical information, preferably in a cancer registry or medical records department plus successful completion of a two-year college level curriculum in such fields as medical records, nursing, biological sciences, or equivalent combination of education and experience.  Within 12 months of obtaining position, must meet criteria established by the National Cancer Registrars Association Council on Certification and subsequently must pass the Certified Tumor Registrar (CTR) exam by the scheduled testing date immediately following 12 months in position (at the latest).  Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of medical terminology, anatomy, cancer diagnoses and treatment modalities and various medical record systems.  Requires the ability to work independently; good attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy; good interpersonal skills.  Demonstrates ability to take initiative, use good judgment and work as part of a team.  Requires a strong interest and the ability to work with a variety of computerized information, data sources and databases.  Valid California driver’s license and car insurance is required; must have regular access to a vehicle and the ability to travel within and out of the reporting area. Vehicle used must have minimum level of insurance at all times as established by CPIC. Periodic verification of driver’s license status as well as proof of insurance coverage is required.  Requires physical health/stamina to transport laptop computer, medical records/charts and reference materials is required.  This position requires the manner of dress suitable for the working environment when in the field.  Knowledge of California state cancer reporting requirements, case finding methodology and cancer case abstraction is preferred.  Experience working in a central or hospital registry or cancer registry is preferred.  Knowledge of cancer registry software preferred.  An equal opportunity employer and E-Verify participant, CPIC offers an attractive compensation package, including exceptional benefits and a friendly, collaborative working environment. We are located in Fremont, California, immediately adjacent to BART, an ideal commute option.
jobtitle: Oncology Data Specialist (without CTR) - Fremont, CA 1607

description: About the Agency   ***Amended education requirement section and extended the close date to 3/29/2016***   The Advanced Computing Branch (Code TNC) within the Exploration Technology Directorate (Code T) at NASA Ames Research Center is currently seeking interested applicants for the position of Computer Scientist. The incumbent serves as a member of the Supercomputer Systems Team and contributes in the development, design, and/or selection of High-End Computing (HEC) hardware and software, computational systems, operating systems, high-speed and high reliability networks to meet the operational and data systems needs of NASA's users of advanced computing systems.   To receive consideration, you must submit a resume and answer NASA-specific questions. The NASA questions appear after you submit your resume and are transferred to the NASA web site. If you successfully apply, USAJOBS will show your application status as 'Received'. If your status is 'Application Status Not Available', you have not successfully applied. Do not rely on a USAJOBS email to confirm successful application. Only an email from NASA confirms a successful application.   As identical vacancies are identified, additional selections may be made.   This announcement has been amended to extend through 3/29/2016.   KEY REQUIREMENTS A one-year probationary period may be required Position subject to pre-employment background investigation  DUTIES: As a computer scientist, the incumbent serves as a member of the Supercomputer Systems Team and assists the High End Computing Capability (HECC) Project Senior Supercomputing Systems Engineer. He/she assists in the development and design of a High-End Computing (HEC) environment including hardware and software stack to meet the operational and data systems needs for advanced computing systems. The incumbent participates in the evaluation, procurement, implementation, monitoring, maintenance, and operation of HEC computational systems, high-speed and high reliability networks, Input/Output (I/O) infrastructure and supporting peripheral and parallel file systems.   The incumbent identifies performance issues in HEC computing hardware and software, conducts systems analysis, and develops modifications/enhancements for the improvement of operational performance. This includes evaluating proposed software systems including operating systems from the perspective of user productivity and system performance. He/she verifies and validates new and proposed software packages for HEC systems including the implementation and management of such systems. The current environment is an Intel based high performance computer system interconnected by a high-bandwidth low latency InfiniBand network with a Lustre-based file system providing a shared I/O infrastructure.   The incumbent assists in the design, development, initial use and turnover to operations of software tools for improvement of parallel processing scientific applications. He/she works with scientists, researchers, engineers, and technologists to identify and understand appropriate NASA use cases that will demonstrate the viability and effectiveness of the tools. The incumbent assist in the development and implementation of new and improved concepts, techniques or systems for a broad range of inter-disciplinary activities and highly specialized functions. As an example, the incumbent tracks poor application performance to ineffective communications and optimizes the communication by understanding the application's message passing pattern and the protocol's of the communication library and the interconnect hardware, devises an optimal solution and deploys it. He/she applies HEC computing techniques to solve real-world problems using requirements and/or emerging technologies and methodologies.   QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED: Applicant must have one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade, which has equipped the applicant with the particular competencies needed to successfully perform the duties of the position described above.   Specialized experience is defined as experience in one of the following: high-end computing, parallel file systems, or high-end computing interconnect to evaluate/identify problems, develop and implement solutions to meet the operational and/or data systems performance needs of advanced computing systems, or equivalent.   Basic Education Requirement: A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with major study in engineering, physical science, mathematics, life sciences, computer science, or other field of science. Degrees in engineering technology are not considered to be qualifying for this position.   Applicants must complete the following fields in USAJOBS Resume Builder, Step 2. Education section in  order for education qualifications to be considered for this position:  -School or Program Name  -Country  -State/Territory/Province  -City/Town  -Degree/Level Attained  -Completion date  -Major  -Minor  -GPA   U.S. citizenship is required. description: Online Advertising is one of the fastest growing businesses on the Internet today, with about $70 billion of a $600 billion advertising market already online.  Search engines, web publishers, major ad networks, and ad exchanges are now serving billions of ad impressions per day and generating terabytes of user events data every day. The rapid growth of online advertising has created enormous opportunities as well as technical challenges that demand computational intelligence. Computational Advertising has emerged as a new interdisciplinary field that involves information retrieval, machine learning, data mining, statistics, operations research, and micro-economics, to solve challenging problems that arise in online advertising. The central problem of computational advertising is to select an optimized slate of eligible ads for a user to maximize a total utility function that captures the expected revenue, user experience and return on investment for advertisers.  Microsoft is innovating rapidly in this space to grow its share of this market by providing the advertising industry with the state-of-the-art online advertising platform and service. Bing Ads Relevance and Revenue (RnR) team is at the core of this effort, responsible for research & development of all the algorithmic components in our advertising technology stack, including,  • User/query intent understanding, document/ad understanding, user targeting  • Relevance modeling, IR-based ad retrieval  • User response (click & conversion) prediction using large scale machine learning algorithms  • Marketplace mechanism design and optimization, and whole-page experience optimization  • Personalization  • Innovative new ads products  • Network protection, fraud detection, traffic quality measurement  • Advertising metrics and measurement, including relevance and ad campaign effectiveness  • Data mining and analytics  • Supply-demand forecasting  • Ad campaign planning and optimization  • Experimentation infrastructure including tools for configuring and launching experiments, dashboard, live marketplace monitoring, and diagnosis.   We heavily use the recent advances in grid or cloud computing infrastructure to harness huge volume of data for solving many of the above mentioned problems. We love big data!  The RnR team is a world-class R&D; team of passionate and talented scientists and engineers who aspire to solve challenging problems and turn innovative ideas into high-quality products and services that can help hundreds of millions of users and advertisers, and directly impact our business. Our experimentation infrastructure allows us to innovate and test new algorithms rapidly with live traffic to measure their effectiveness, and launch them in production as soon as they produce positive results, which makes our work environment productive and rewarding.   The Ads Understanding and Selection team in Bing Ads is responsible for developing scalable analytics solutions and systems in the areas of automatic advertiser campaign generation, effective user targeting, personalized ads selection, ad content and format optimization. The team also works on a number of new initiatives to improve advertising campaign efficiency and advertiser on-boarding experience, as well as technologies underling novel marketing offerings to leverage the synergy between search and display advertising capabilities.   Roles & Responsibilities:  We are looking for a Sr. applied scientist with deep R&D; background to conduct research and development on intelligent search advertising system to mine and learn actionable insights from large scale data and signals we collect from user queries and online activities, advertiser created campaigns and their performances, and myriad responses from the parties touched by the system in Bing ads paid search ecosystem. The person will play a key role to drive algorithmic and modeling improvement to the system, analyze performance and identify opportunities based on offline and online testing, develop and deliver robust and scalable solutions, make direct impact to both user and advertisers experience, and continually increase the revenue for Bing ads.   Skills & Qualificactions:  1. Outstanding expertise and research experience on statistical machine learning, data mining, information retrieval, optimization, Bayesian inference and MCMC.  2. Excellent problem solving and data analysis skills.  3. Passionate, self-motivated.  4. Effective communication skills, both verbal and written.  5. Strong software design and development skills/experience.  6. PhD degree in CS/EE or related areas is required.  7. Familiarity with distributed data processing/analysis and modeling paradigm, such as Map-Reduce and MPI, is preferred.  8. Experience in online advertising is a plus.   Microsoft is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) and strongly supports diversity in the work place.   Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status.  XIPGERX

description: Personalization analytics is a team dedicated to supporting the algorithm research/engineering teams at Netflix. As part of Netflix's greater personalization efforts we partner with leading researchers as they determine the best way (through algorithm development and data) to make each user's experience unique and customized. This means that we build datasets for the purpose of analysis, collaborate with modeling experts to build data pipelines, and manage the large/offline datasets that enable personalization. The perfect person will have a background in a quantitative/technical field, will have rich experience working with large data sets, and will have some experience in data-driven decision making.   Responsibilities:   Partnering with internal customers. You will partner with data scientists, algorithm engineers, and data engineers to solve business problems as they become computationally intractable. Prototype and productize data feeds that for downstream predictive models. You should enjoy taking abstract/vague requirements and crystallizing them into crisp deliverables. Build/Deploy/Improve internal-built data tools. You will be expected to contribute to internal tools that enable efficiency throughout Netflix. These tools will be used for both analysis and data processing. As these tools mature you will encouraged to make them available via open source.   Skills & Characteristics:   Experience building production data pipelines (using Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Spark, etc.) on web-scale datasets. You should have an unmistakable passion for elegant and intuitive dataset design. Hands on and deep experience with schema design and data modeling. Programming proficiency in at least one major language (Java, Scala, C++, even Fortran!). You strive to write beautiful code, and you're comfortable working in a variety of tech stacks. You are a well-rounded, top performer who is able to "crunch the numbers" and think critically through strategic issues. You move seamlessly between code and analytical concepts. You're ambitious and willing to take action, but not stubborn. You recognize when you're wrong and move past your own mistakes. You leave your desk & collaborate. You recognize the value in face-to-face contact. (Not to be mistaken with extroversion.) You work hard, and you have healthy boundaries. You know how to prioritize both your work and personal commitments without set boundaries or guidelines. General knowledge of predictive modeling and algorithms.   Two more things to know:   We expect a lot. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about it at jobs.netflix.com. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description: Coursera is scaling a global platform to provide universal access to the world’s best education, and we’re driven by the passion and mission to let people learn without limits. We use data to drive our products and our business, and to better serve our learners.   We’re looking for a talented, creative, and driven data scientist with a sharp eye for UX design, strong algorithmic and analytic skills, and an interest in expanding the reach and quality of online education by guiding product development and optimizing growth. Our ideal candidate is an independent, analytically-minded individual with strong software engineering and quantitative research skills who shares our passion for education. In this role, you’ll be directly involved in the development, implementation, and evaluation of discovery products, targeted messaging, and general growth strategies.   Your responsibilities Modeling user behavior to identify and prioritize product and business opportunities to drive global learner growth on both web and mobile Designing and testing high leverage growth interventions including in on-platform catalog search, content recommendations, and targeted messaging Working cross-functionally with engineers, designers, and product managers on our core growth products Your skills Strong background in applied math, computer science, statistics, economics, or related technical field Proficient with at least one scripting language (e.g. Python) Proficient with at least one statistical software package (e.g. R) Excellent communication and project management skills An ideal candidate will also have 2+ or 6+ years of industry experience in a relevant role Proficient with relational databases and SQL Familiarity with domain-specific technologies and challenges in search and discovery, personalization, and/or messaging algorithms

description: About the Agency   The Exobiology Branch (Code SSX) of the Science Directorate (Code S) at the NASA Ames Research Center is seeking candidates for Research Physical Scientist position. This position serves as an expert in biomarker research and is responsible for conducting a basic research program in biogeochemistry, with the goal of understanding a broad range of biological processes. This position conducts microbiological and geological research to identify biosignatures that can reveal and characterize past or present life in environments relevant to astrobiology and NASA missions.   To receive consideration, you must submit a resume and answer NASA-specific questions. The NASA questions appear after you submit your resume and are transferred to the NASA web site. If you successfully apply, USAJOBS will show your application status as 'Received'. If your status is 'Application Status Not Available', you have not successfully applied. Do not rely on a USAJOBS email to confirm successful application. Only an email from NASA confirms a successful application.   As identical vacancies are identified, additional selections may be made.   KEY REQUIREMENTS Position subject to pre-employment background investigation A one-year probationary period may be required Selectee must complete a financial disclosure statement A minimum background investigation is required  DUTIES: This is a research position engaged in professional scientific and engineering work which is systematic, critical, intensive investigation directed toward discovering, disseminating, and applying new or expanded knowledge in a professional discipline. The incumbent conducts systematic research in problem areas that are highly complex and of considerable scope. The researcher investigates modern microorganisms and environmental samples, ancient terrestrial rocks, and Mars/Europa analog rocks/minerals/ices to support the interpretation of mission data and the identification of 'habitable' exo-planets. He/she develops research proposals in response to research opportunities and publishes research results in national and international peer-reviewed scientific journals.   The researcher addresses two or more of the following categories of biosignatures: remotely detectable features on planetary surfaces (e.g. spectral reflectance of photosynthetic pigments) and characteristic temporal changes in planetary properties (e.g. seasonally-mediated cycles of biogenic atmospheric gases), cellular and extracellular morphologies, biogenic fabrics in rocks, bio-organic molecular structures, chirality, biogenic minerals, and biogenic stable isotope patterns in minerals and/or organic compounds. The incumbent identifies and characterizes biosignatures in microorganisms or natural samples by integrating measurements obtained from state-of-the-art analytical instrumentation. He/she contributes to the design of instrumentation for NASA missions through research that can enhance the search for novel biosignatures on other worlds.   The incumbent determines areas for investigation and provides advice and recommendations to colleagues regarding new approaches to scientific problems; and determines the extent to which objectives are accomplished and if changes are necessary. He/she recommends changes, redirection of effort, and additions to the basic projects to maintain desired objectives. The investigator contributes to the development and deployment of instrumentation for NASA missions, including testing potential spaceflight instrumentation in controlled laboratory and relevant analog environments, and the development of crucial testbeds for real-time problem solving.   QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED: Applicant must have one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade, which has equipped the applicant with the particular competencies needed to successfully perform the duties of the position described above.   GS-13: Specialized experience is defined as experience in conducting microbiological and geologic research to identify and characterize biosignatures; AND experience developing research proposals; AND experience in publishing research results in leading journals, or equivalent.   Basic Education Requirement: A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with major study in engineering, physical science, mathematics, life sciences, computer science, or other field of science. Degrees in engineering technology are not considered to be qualifying for this position.   U.S. citizenship is required. description: Facebook was built to help people connect and share, and over the last decade our tools have played a critical part in changing how people around the world communicate with one another. With over a billion people using the service and more than fifty offices around the globe, a career at Facebook offers countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing organization. Facebook is seeking a highly quantitative Data Scientist for the Revenue Forecasting & Analytics (RFA) team. The RFA team is a uniquely data intensive part of Facebook’s finance organization, and plays a crucial role in delivering key revenue insights to senior management.  This position will focus on forecasting and analyzing revenue as well as conducting collaborative, deep-dive analyses to understand high-level business trends. Successful candidates will enjoy working with one of the richest data sets in the world, cutting edge technology, and the ability to see your insights turned into real business decisions on a regular basis. The perfect candidate will have a background in related quantitative or technical field, will have experience working with large data sets, and will have some experience in data-driven decision making. The role offers significant responsibility along with an opportunity to have company-wide impact and quick career advancement.  The position is located in Menlo Park, CA and is full-time. Responsibilities Analyze large datasets, interpret trends, and identify actionable insights and opportunities. Combine business and product knowledge with historical data to build forecasts in Excel, R, and/or Python. Analyze sources of variance.  Communicate results and recommendations to business leaders in a clear, actionable, and engaging way. Engage with other departments to stay up-to-date on the latest product developments and develop revenue incrementality models for new businesses. description: Genia Technologies is a nanopore based sequencing company dedicated to making genetic testing easy and affordable. We are developing a revolutionary, low cost, portable, DNA/RNA reader that can be used to improve the lives of people in a wide variety of applications including the timely screening of newborns for diseases and the diagnosis of cancers and infectious diseases.   Genia is looking for a motivated and team-oriented individual who is passionate about revolutionary sequencing technology. As a Scientist you will become an expert on the theory and operation of the new Genia Single Molecule Sequencing platform and help take the machine from an advanced proof of principle to an operational laboratory instrument. Drawing on experience in biology and software the candidate will run wet-lab experiments and develop new, or adjust existing, software codes to optimize operation of the sequencer. Using analysis programs, the candidate will manipulate and present experimental results to answer various system questions. The candidate will help create new operating modes and sample assays to make economical sequencing a reality. The candidate must be self-motivated and able to work well in a team.   Responsibilities:  Become an expert on the operation of the Genia Single Molecule Sequencing Platform Characterize assays and analyze results of instrument operation with various sample preparations and under various operating parameters Be a key contributor to the creation of instrument operating protocols Help define and perform assay development in a fast-paced environment Debug instrumentation mechanical and software issues to create a robust platform Assist lab personnel by customizing analysis codes to understand system performance Optimize instrument performance for quick set-up, high throughput, and high speed sequencing results Who you are You’re someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests across functions and geographies. Where a job title is not considered the final definition of who you are, but the starting point.  B.S. in computer science, electrical engineering, statistics, or a related discipline with a background in molecular biology, biology, or biochemistry OR B.S. in a Biology discipline with the ability to perform statistical analysis of data with programs such as JMP, Matlab, R. Familiarity with computer programming in languages such as or Python is a plus Familiarity with the Linux or Unix operating systems a plus Understanding of DNA manipulation techniques and sequencing methodologies Meticulous attention to detail and excellent written and electronic record keeping skills Strong oral and written communication skills  Who we are At Roche, 91,700 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.   Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individual’s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

description: Project Wing is working on self-flying vehicles that could open up entirely new approaches to delivering goods and services—including options that are cheaper, faster, less wasteful and more environmentally sensitive than what’s possible today. Project Wing is a part of X.  The Project Wing team is developing an aerial delivery system based on self-flying aircraft (UAVs) operating in commercial air space.  As an engineer for Project Wing, you have excellent technical education and experience in estimation and perception techniques, simulation, and multi-modal sensor fusion. You have an outstanding track record of successful development of complex sensing and perception solutions from concept through successful deployment of technology into the marketplace. You have a proven ability to work within teams of highly talented, diverse engineers through solving tough technology problems that enable valuable business solutions.  Your primary responsibility includes developing the navigation and perception solutions that enable safe and reliable operation of self-flying aircraft in close proximity to people, terrain, buildings, and other ground obstructions. You are skilled at collaborating with cross-disciplinary team members to invent and create efficient technological solutions with creative and prolific skill. You have a bias for action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive technology development at Google speed. Responsibilities  Create innovative, reliable, and efficient navigation and perception solutions to enable new and challenging aircraft capabilities.  Work with multidisciplinary engineering teams to identify solutions and take them from concept to production.  Participate in and support testing and integration efforts for the navigation and perception systems.  Perform detailed analyses of system designs and test data, communicating the results to the Project Wing team and external partners and agencies.  Minimum Qualifications  MS degree in Robotics, Aerospace, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience. 3 years of experience working with visual odometry, visual SLAM or other techniques, involving optimal estimation of camera motion or scene geometry from imagery with aerial or ground vehicles. Experience programming in C/C++. Experience in estimation, dynamics, and controls.  Preferred Qualifications  5 years of experience working with multiple of the skills listed as minimum qualifications.  2 years of industry experience working with multiple of the skills listed as minimum qualifications.  Experience with one or more of the following: visual/inertial integration, aerial image registration, point cloud processing, path planning.  Experience specifying, selecting, and integrating cameras and other sensors. X projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a radically better place. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x].

description: Senior Data Scientist (DAM)   LinkedIn was built to help professionals achieve more in their careers, and every day millions of people use our products to make connections, discover opportunities and gain insights. Our global reach means we get to make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can. We’re much more than a digital resume – we transform lives through innovative products and technology.   Searching for your dream job? At LinkedIn, we strive to help our employees find passion and purpose. Join us in changing the way the world works.   Consumer Analytics at LinkedIn influences our products in ways immediately felt by our members. We thrive on collaborating with LinkedIn's product development teams to build data-fueled products which our members love. We own our metrics, track them carefully and are nimble in analyzing trends.   Can you think out of the box to envision how an accurate, timely business intelligence report will allow us to deliver transformative insights?   Do you have what it takes to quickly seize opportunities and leverage the power of programming to unite terabytes of "professional" data and expose hidden insights through dazzling visualizations?   The Data Scientist on the Data Analytics and Measurement team (DAM) plays an important role in defining, computing and visualizing the most important, actionable metrics our Executives use to measure and assess our Member Value Propositions. This high-visibility role affords collaboration with the product and engineering teams behind such revolutionary products as People You May Know, Endorsements, and Who Viewed My Profile.   Responsibilities  Provide KPIs, dashboards and deeper insights into product trends to our Executives and Product Managers by tapping directly into our data sources using a combination SQL, Hive, Pig, Python, Java and Tableau. Collaborate with engineering teams to root-cause data problems, devise robust fixes and correct the impacted data. Engage with internal technology partners to prototype and validate tools developed in-house for near-realtime processing of very large data sets. Investigate data errors, construct queries to correct affected data sets and keep stakeholders apprised of progress by planning and tracking tasks using Agile methodologies.  Basic Qualifications:  B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operation Research, Economics, or related quantitative field of study. Experience working with databases, such as through SQL, Hive, etc. Experience working in an Unix/Linux environment.  Preferred Qualifications:  3 - 5 years industry experience 3+ years work experience analyzing very large datasets with SQL (Teradata, Oracle, or MySQL) - Pig experience desired. 2+ years work experience providing analytical insights and business reports to product or business functions. Experience in presenting insights to executive staff on a regular basis a plus. 2+ years work experience programming in Java or Python. 1+ years experience with Tableau, QlikView, Microstrategy, or other data visualization and BI dashboarding tools. 1+ years experience working with distributed computing platform and tools (Hadoop, Pig, Hive, Spark, etc.) Proficiency in Unix/Linux for automating processes with shell scripting. Experience with R or other statistical package. Strong interest in working with Big Data, and making it accessible for the broader organization. Highly Productive : Ability to choose between competing technology solutions to find the right solution for the problem at hand. The ideal candidate will approach all problems with a holistic view toward future enhancements, ease of maintainability and leverage of emerging technologies. Strong Programming Skills: Success in this role requires hands-on work analyzing data captured from our products using a combination of Hive, Pig, Java, Python, and SQL, executed in our Hadoop framework. Prototyping metrics necessitates mastery of visualization tools like Tableau. Proven Communication Skills: This is a high-visibility role with direct exposure to our senior executives who are data-driven decision makers. Complex technical issues, actionable recommendations and their business impact must be stated concisely, both verbally and in writing. High-energy, Team-first, "Get it done" attitude : Must be motivated to work hard in a fast-paced environment to develop and track metrics for our company-wide Member Value Propositions, constructively accepting input from diverse stakeholders across the organization

description: Whether you’re guiding a user through a shift in context or expressing the personality of your brand, motion and animation are key ingredients to refine a user's experience on every screen— from mobile phones and tablets to desktops and beyond. At Google, we use motion design to help tell a product’s story, guide our users, improve usability and make the user’s experience responsive and fun. As a Motion Designer, it’s your job to apply your passion for animation to simplify complex interactions and solve challenging design problems.  In this role, you’ll help define and implement Google’s motion design language across all platforms—this includes driving the creation of best practices, collaborating with visual and interaction designers, and working with other product teams. You’ll think critically about how motion reinforces Google’s UX objectives, enhances interactivity, and delights our users.  Play a vital role in building out a new medium for computing and entertainment. Virtual Reality (VR) is rapidly evolving as an important new area in personal computing and content creation. The Google VR team is a fast-moving group of designers, engineers, PMs and research scientists, tasked with building the foundations for great VR, developing best-in-class VR apps and prototyping novel, delightful user experiences. The project started as a 20% project with Google Cardboard. It has since evolved into a vibrant team of full-time VR enthusiasts at Google.  You are a detail-oriented motion designer who understands how form influences function, can weave motion into interaction design and simplify complexity. Responsibilities  Contribute to the overall vision and user strategy for Cardboard/VR apps and platforms, from concept exploration through implementation, working closely with UX and software engineers to build designs.  Define and implement the motion design language for VR and Augmented Reality (AR) products and apps.  Provide patterns, best practices and guidance on animation and transitions for different devices and platforms including web, Android, and iOS.  Collaborate with fellow UX designers as they incorporate motion into their work to enhance interactivity, delight users, and bring beauty, life, and motion to VR experiences.  Minimum Qualifications  BA/BS degree in Design (e.g., interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), HCI, CS or a related field or equivalent practical experience.  Experience with UX design.  Portfolio that includes motion and interaction in game, film/video, web or mobile contexts.  Preferred Qualifications  Experience with real time engines and what they do to animation curve data.  Experience with using motion to reduce perceived latency. Propensity to focus on detailed aspects of motion and experience, often related to physics, patterns, and visual design elements; ability to use motion to express sentimental or emotional experience.  Experience working collaboratively with teams: research scientists, UI and 3D artists, interaction designers, game developers, full-stack software and hardware engineers, marketing and business teams.  Proficient in principles of animation; ability to use motion to a narrative effect and understanding the future of interactive motion and strong conceptual skills.  Ability to fuse creativity and code to deliver cutting edge interactions.  A strong acumen for user experience design and how motion design influences UI and interaction design (and vice versa).  Area  Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to tackle some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From AdWords to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.

description: Verily Life Sciences is focused on shifting health care from a reactive, undifferentiated approach to a proactive, targeted approach by transforming the detection, prevention, management and even our basic understanding of disease.  As a Verily Computational Biologist you will conduct basic and applied scientific research into novel instrumentation, drug delivery, and diagnostic technologies. You will also develop data analysis methods, apply statistical machine learning tools to identify molecular/physiological/clinical markers of disease progression, and build integrative, mechanistic models to understand large-scale biological datasets. As a Computational Biologist, you will play a major role in driving our research projects like Baseline, nanoparticles, bio-sensing devices, and more. You will also help Verily scientists in other areas with data analyses or algorithm development, and interact with investigators from partner institutions to carve out new research directions. Responsibilities  Work with experimental scientists and clinicians to drive and support Verily research  Develop novel methods and algorithms for data processing and analysis in the field  Work with software engineers to turn novel methods into large scale tools leveraging Google’s internal infrastructure  Create scientifically rigorous publications, communications and presentations.  Minimum Qualifications  PhD or MD degree in a relevant field, or equivalent practical experience.  Experience analyzing data sets in the context of relevant diseases (e.g., immunology, oncology, metabolic, cardiology, neurology).  Experience with relevant scripting tools (e.g., R, Python, Perl, MATLAB, Lua/Scala/Ruby).  Experience with data analysis tools to manipulate datasets.  Preferred Qualifications  5 years of postdoctoral or management experience in an academia or industry setting.  Experience analyzing translational and clinical data in a drug discovery or development environment, with a strong disease genetics, or clinical research.  Experience with one or more of the following data types: next generation sequencing (DNA, methylation, RNA), microbiome metagenomics, immune profiling (cytometry, immunosequencing), mass spectrometry (proteomics, metabolomics), imaging (MRI, digital microscopy).  Demonstrated ability to design and implement algorithms and methods in C/C++ or Java, especially in collaborative software and data analysis development environments (i.e. source control, code and analysis reviews, API use and definition).  Expertise with integrative, mechanistic, network, and/or predictive modeling.  Excellent oral and written communication skills  Area  The Verily Life Sciences team is focused on helping to move healthcare from reactive to proactive. Combining expertise from the fields of biology, chemistry, physics, medicine, electrical engineering, computer science, we’re developing new technology tools for physicians that can integrate easily into daily life and help transform the detection, prevention, and management of disease. Current projects in development include a smart contact lens with miniaturized glucose sensor ; a nanodiagnostics platform to help with early detection of disease ; and Liftware utensils for people with tremor. For more information, please see our website .
snippet: Experience analyzing translational and clinical data in a drug discovery or development environment, with a strong disease genetics, or clinical research....

description: Consumers around the world are embracing the Internet TV revolution. We just launched into 130 new countries and need a ton of data and insights to guide our growth. We scale quickly and smartly through leveraging online marketing and our ability to deliver targeted messaging through innovative algorithms and engineering. We experiment, analyze, and engineer our way to providing a highly personalized experience consumers should expect from Netflix, as well as to scale efficiently, adapt to changing market conditions, and shift spend rapidly.  The Marketing Data Engineering and Analytics team is crucial to reaching our strategic marketing goals. We are in need of an exceptional analyst who can dig deep into our data for insights and translate them into scalable, smart, and user friendly analytics products that anyone can use and understand. If you’re a data geek who loves to tell the story behind the metrics; if you stay up at night tinkering with your D3 or Tableau until the viz is just right, just because it’s fun...then this is the right place for you.  What You Will Do: Transform the way our marketers consume data and insights through highly usable and visually stunning data products. Apply your exceptional analytics expertise for deeper understanding of our marketing ecosystem. Conceptualize and deliver actionable insights for marketing. Identify and develop the insights worth repeating into scalable data products. Continually research and improve new methods and technologies in the analytics and visualization space. Apply your learnings to what you build. Be a strategic partner and influencer with wide cross functional team of data scientist, engineers, and FP&A; analysts and leaders for analytically enabling marketing.  Who You Are: A quant who can tell a story with data, as well as visualize it with a variety of tools (Tableau, MicroStrategy, D3, etc). Solid foundation with analytics and building data products, you have deep understanding of the intricacies of solving data problems. Expert at querying and manipulating large volume of data for analysis and visualization. Strong quantitative background. You strive for creativity, out of the box thinking, and experimentation in your work and projects. Extensive history of collaborating closely with analytics professionals (analysts, data scientists, data engineers) to problem solve. Comfortable with ambiguity and thrive in a fast moving, ever changing environment. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills Can problem solve your way out of anything

description: As a member of a fast-paced multi-disciplinary team, you use your creativity and diverse range of engineering experience to explore solutions to a variety of engineering problems. As a mechanical engineer, you participate in the design, analysis, and prototyping of new concepts. You work in a manufacturing and product oriented development environment and collaborate with vendors and outside sources in order to see parts through to manufacture.  Our project is seeking to fill a mechanical engineering position, focused on the development of agile, high-accuracy and compact optical beam steering mechanisms. The scope of responsibilities include collaborating closely with controls systems, optics and opto-mechanical engineers on the team to rapidly prototype beam steering mechanisms that operate in harsh environmental conditions, as well as evaluate the performance of existing prototypes. You're a highly-motivated individual that enjoys working in a small dynamic team environment. Responsibilities  Design high-accuracy coarse and fine pointing assemblies that can steer optical beams.  Evaluate performance and troubleshooting of existing coarse-pointing prototypes.  Design assemblies that maintain compliance with operational requirements over a wide thermal range.  Conduct finite-element and modal analysis.  Provide environmental (thermal, structural, EMI, etc.) test preparation, setup and data analysis.  Minimum Qualifications  BS degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.  4 years of relevant work experience. Experience with designing agile, light-weight, compact and high-accuracy pointing mechanisms, with potentially multiple stages (e.g., coarse pointing and fine pointing).  Experience in finite-element analysis to evaluate thermally-induced stresses and structural modes.  Experience in one of the mainstream 3D mechanical engineering CAD software programs.  Preferred Qualifications  MS degree in Mechanical Engineering.  5 years of relevant work experience.  Experience with opto-mechanical systems as well as control systems.  Hands-on experience with environmental testing infrastructure (e.g., thermal chambers, shake tables, etc.)  Familiarity with tooling and processes for volume production of hardware.  Familiarity with passive isolation, stray-light elimination, and protective structures against impact forces.  Area  X is a moonshot factory where uncomfortably ambitious, potentially world-changing new ideas such as self-driving cars, balloon-powered Internet and smart contact lenses are developed and taken out into the world. X projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a radically better place. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x].

description: About the Agency   ***Amended education requirement section and extended the close date to 3/29/2016***   The Advanced Computing Branch (Code TNC) within the Exploration Technology Directorate (Code T) at NASA Ames Research Center is currently seeking interested applicants for the position of Computer Scientist. The incumbent serves as a member of the Supercomputer Systems Team and contributes in the development, design, and/or selection of High-End Computing (HEC) hardware and software, computational systems, operating systems, high-speed and high reliability networks to meet the operational and data systems needs of NASA's users of advanced computing systems.   To receive consideration, you must submit a resume and answer NASA-specific questions. The NASA questions appear after you submit your resume and are transferred to the NASA web site. If you successfully apply, USAJOBS will show your application status as 'Received'. If your status is 'Application Status Not Available', you have not successfully applied. Do not rely on a USAJOBS email to confirm successful application. Only an email from NASA confirms a successful application.   As identical vacancies are identified, additional selections may be made.   This announcement has been amended to extend through 3/29/2016.   KEY REQUIREMENTS A one-year probationary period may be required Position subject to pre-employment background investigation  DUTIES: As a computer scientist, the incumbent serves as a member of the Supercomputer Systems Team and assists the High End Computing Capability (HECC) Project Senior Supercomputing Systems Engineer. He/she assists in the development and design of a High-End Computing (HEC) environment including hardware and software stack to meet the operational and data systems needs for advanced computing systems. The incumbent participates in the evaluation, procurement, implementation, monitoring, maintenance, and operation of HEC computational systems, high-speed and high reliability networks, Input/Output (I/O) infrastructure and supporting peripheral and parallel file systems.   The incumbent identifies performance issues in HEC computing hardware and software, conducts systems analysis, and develops modifications/enhancements for the improvement of operational performance. This includes evaluating proposed software systems including operating systems from the perspective of user productivity and system performance. He/she verifies and validates new and proposed software packages for HEC systems including the implementation and management of such systems. The current environment is an Intel based high performance computer system interconnected by a high-bandwidth low latency InfiniBand network with a Lustre-based file system providing a shared I/O infrastructure.   The incumbent assists in the design, development, initial use and turnover to operations of software tools for improvement of parallel processing scientific applications. He/she works with scientists, researchers, engineers, and technologists to identify and understand appropriate NASA use cases that will demonstrate the viability and effectiveness of the tools. The incumbent assist in the development and implementation of new and improved concepts, techniques or systems for a broad range of inter-disciplinary activities and highly specialized functions. As an example, the incumbent tracks poor application performance to ineffective communications and optimizes the communication by understanding the application's message passing pattern and the protocol's of the communication library and the interconnect hardware, devises an optimal solution and deploys it. He/she applies HEC computing techniques to solve real-world problems using requirements and/or emerging technologies and methodologies.   QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED: Applicant must have one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade, which has equipped the applicant with the particular competencies needed to successfully perform the duties of the position described above.   Specialized experience is defined as experience in one of the following: high-end computing, parallel file systems, or high-end computing interconnect to evaluate/identify problems, develop and implement solutions to meet the operational and/or data systems performance needs of advanced computing systems, or equivalent.   Basic Education Requirement: A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with major study in engineering, physical science, mathematics, life sciences, computer science, or other field of science. Degrees in engineering technology are not considered to be qualifying for this position.   Applicants must complete the following fields in USAJOBS Resume Builder, Step 2. Education section in  order for education qualifications to be considered for this position:  -School or Program Name  -Country  -State/Territory/Province  -City/Town  -Degree/Level Attained  -Completion date  -Major  -Minor  -GPA   U.S. citizenship is required.   HOW YOU WILL BE EVALUATED: NASA uses an automated system (Resumix) that matches the competencies extracted from your resume to the competencies identified by the selecting official for the position. Based on the competencies you match, you are placed in one of three categories identified as 90, 80, or 70 pt. quality categories, which are defined as:   90 pt. Category - Tentatively meets (until subsequent confirmation upon referral) the basic qualification requirements identified in the vacancy announcement and has experience in the same or similar job that has demonstrated superior proficiency in the primary requirements of the position.   80 pt. Category - Tentatively meets (until subsequent confirmation upon referral) the basic qualification requirements identified in the vacancy announcement and demonstrates satisfactory proficiency in the primary requirements of the position.   70 pt. Category - Fails to meet criteria described in the 80 pt. category.   Additional application guidance is available in NASA's Applicant Guide .   Information for Veterans : The Category Rating Process protects the rights of veterans by placing them ahead of non-preference eligibles within each category. Preference eligibles who meet qualification requirements and have a compensable service-connected disability of at least 10 percent must be listed at the top of the highest quality category, except when the position being filled is scientific or professional at the GS-09 grade level or higher.   For the purpose of the Career Transition Assistance Program (CTAP) and the Interagency Career Transition Assistance Program (ICTAP), candidates rated in the top quality category are considered well-qualified   If you are an individual with a disability, you may be eligible to apply to this announcement under the Schedule A Hiring Authority. To receive consideration under this hiring authority, you will need to check mark "Schedule A appointments for person with disabilities" under the "Options" tab when completing the application process. For information regarding the Schedule A Hiring Authority, please visit https://www.opm.gov/disability/PeopleWithDisabilities.asp OR http://nasajobs.nasa.gov/generalinfo/nssc.htm.   BENEFITS: You can review our benefits at: http://nasajobs.nasa.gov/benefits/benefits.htm   OTHER INFORMATION: Any applicant tentatively selected for this position may be required to undergo a pre-employment background investigation. Individuals who have special priority selection rights under the Agency Career Transition Assistance Program (CTAP) or the Interagency Career Transition Assistance Program (ICTAP) must be well qualified for the position to receive consideration for special priority selection. See 'How You Will Be Evaluated' for definition of well qualified. Federal employees seeking CTAP/ICTAP consideration must indicate their eligibility when applying for a position. The USAJOBS resume asks you to identify your ICTAP eligibility; the NASA Supplemental Information asks you to identify your CTAP eligibility. If you are selected for the position, you must be prepared to submit proof that you meet the requirements for CTAP/ICTAP. This includes a copy of the agency notice, a copy of their most recent Performance Rating and a copy of their most recent SF-50 noting current position, grade level, and duty location.   As a condition of employment, male applicants born after December 31, 1959, must certify that they have registered with the Selective Service System, or are exempt from having to do so under the Selective Service Law. In order to receive preference in hiring, you must clearly identify your claim for veterans preference on your resume.   NASA's Applicant Guide provides the information needed to assist you in determining whether or not you can claim 5 or 10 point veterans preference. You should not submit documents to prove your eligibility for veterans preference at this time. However, you must be prepared to submit proof of veterans preference (DD-214, and, if claiming 10-point preference, SF-15 plus proof required by that form) as requested by the Human Resources Office. Veterans preference will only be considered based on what is supported For instance, if you claim 10-point preference, but are only able to document 5-point preference, you will be considered accordingly. If you fail to provide the required documents within the stated time period, we may withdraw a job offer and/or remove you from further consideration.   Your USAJOBS account asks you to assign a name to each of your resumes. When you apply to a NASA position, we will show you the text of the resume you have submitted, but we do not maintain the name you have assigned to that resume. If you wish to keep track of that information, we recommend you make note of it at the time you apply.   Fair Employment Opportunities for Applicants  NASA Credit for National Service   The payment of relocation expenses is authorized.   Identification of promotion potential in this position does not constitute a commitment or an obligation on the part of management to promote the employee. Promotion will depend upon administrative approval and the continuing need for an actual assignment and performance of higher level duties.   The payment of relocation expenses is authorized.   HOW TO APPLY: This vacancy is being filled through NASA STARS, an automated Staffing and Recruitment System. NASA partners with USAJOBS in providing a seamless application process. Before you begin the application process, please read the vacancy announcement carefully and have all required information available. You may begin the process of submitting your resume by clicking on the 'Apply Online' link. In order to be considered, you must submit a resume completed on the USAJOBS site. When completing your USAJOBS resume, please remember that NASA limits resumes to approximately 32,000 characters including spaces. NASA does not accept resumes uploaded to USAJOBS from a second source or documents attached through USAJOBS' document attachment feature. Once you submit your resume to NASA, you will be asked to complete a short series of additional questions. You must finish the entire process in order to have a complete application package and receive consideration. Your answers will not be saved unless you finish the entire application. You may edit a previously-submitted application, if the announcement is still open. If you are unable to apply electronically for this position, submit your resume and supplemental questions to:  National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)  4200 Rideout Road  Resume Operations Center/Mailstop: HS50  Marshall Space Flight Center, AL 35812.   DO NOT submit your resume directly to the Center advertising this vacancy. Mailed resumes must be received by the close of business on the closing date of the announcement. Hard copy resumes requirements are provided at: Hard Copy Resume Requirements . If you are a first time applicant, we recommend that you review NASA's Applicant Guide to ensure that you are providing a complete resume. Failure to submit the supplemental data and a resume that contains all of the required information may result in loss of consideration for positions in which you are interested. All applications must be received no later than midnight Eastern Time on the closing date of the announcement.   REQUIRED DOCUMENTS: NASA's application process has been specifically developed to ensure that we only ask you for the information we absolutely need to evaluate your qualifications and eligibility. In order to apply for this position, you only need to submit your resume and answer the screening questions and supplemental information. No additional documentation is accepted at the time of application. (For example you need not submit narrative 'KSA' statements; they are not required and will not be evaluated.) In this way we allow you to focus on preparing a resume that best describes your background and abilities. For assistance in preparing your resume, consult the Applicant Guide . Nothing further is required until requested by the Human Resources Office. At that point, we may ask you to submit documentation to support statements made in your resume. For example, we may ask you to provide academic transcripts or proof of Federal employment status. If you are claiming veterans' preference, we may ask you to submit proof of veterans preference (DD-214, and, if claiming 10-point preference, SF-15 plus proof required by that form). If you fail to provide the required documents within the stated time period, we may withdraw a job offer and/or remove you from further consideration.   AGENCY CONTACT INFO: Ames Jobs  Email: arc-amesjobs@mail.nasa.gov  Agency Information:  NASA's Resume Operations Center  4200 Rideout Road, Mailstop HS50  Marshall Space Flight Center, AL  35812  US

description: Requisition No.: 121689BR  Subsidiary: eBay Marketplaces Primary Job Responsibilities: Research Scientist, Computer Vision  Primary Responsibilities At eBay, our systems scale to billions of transactions per day, and we run our sites 24x7 with 99.99% reliability. We pride ourselves to be the leader in cloud computing, Big Data, search, and many other lead-edge technologies. We are seeking highly qualified computer vision research scientists to work on problems such as Large Scale Visual Search/Detection/Recognition, Fine Grained Classification, Deep Learning, Attribute Discovery and Localization, Weakly Supervised Learning, Semantic Segmentation and OCR.  Requirements  With hundreds of millions of buyers and sellers, hundreds of millions of live listings at any point of time, millions of daily transactions and billions of daily queries, eBay provides an amazing playground for researchers to work with data and conduct experiments at scale. We actively pursue ideas that result in scalable algorithms and systems, while leveraging the scale of data. We are seeking highly qualified computer vision research scientists to work on problems such as Large Scale Visual Search/Detection/Recognition, Fine Grained Classification, Deep Learning, Attribute Discovery and Localization, Weakly Supervised Learning, Semantic Segmentation and OCR.
