description: Senior Data Scientist (DAM)   LinkedIn was built to help professionals achieve more in their careers, and every day millions of people use our products to make connections, discover opportunities and gain insights. Our global reach means we get to make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can. We’re much more than a digital resume – we transform lives through innovative products and technology.   Searching for your dream job? At LinkedIn, we strive to help our employees find passion and purpose. Join us in changing the way the world works.   Consumer Analytics at LinkedIn influences our products in ways immediately felt by our members. We thrive on collaborating with LinkedIn's product development teams to build data-fueled products which our members love. We own our metrics, track them carefully and are nimble in analyzing trends.   Can you think out of the box to envision how an accurate, timely business intelligence report will allow us to deliver transformative insights?   Do you have what it takes to quickly seize opportunities and leverage the power of programming to unite terabytes of "professional" data and expose hidden insights through dazzling visualizations?   The Data Scientist on the Data Analytics and Measurement team (DAM) plays an important role in defining, computing and visualizing the most important, actionable metrics our Executives use to measure and assess our Member Value Propositions. This high-visibility role affords collaboration with the product and engineering teams behind such revolutionary products as People You May Know, Endorsements, and Who Viewed My Profile.   Responsibilities  Provide KPIs, dashboards and deeper insights into product trends to our Executives and Product Managers by tapping directly into our data sources using a combination SQL, Hive, Pig, Python, Java and Tableau. Collaborate with engineering teams to root-cause data problems, devise robust fixes and correct the impacted data. Engage with internal technology partners to prototype and validate tools developed in-house for near-realtime processing of very large data sets. Investigate data errors, construct queries to correct affected data sets and keep stakeholders apprised of progress by planning and tracking tasks using Agile methodologies.  Basic Qualifications:  B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Operation Research, Economics, or related quantitative field of study. Experience working with databases, such as through SQL, Hive, etc. Experience working in an Unix/Linux environment.  Preferred Qualifications:  3 - 5 years industry experience 3+ years work experience analyzing very large datasets with SQL (Teradata, Oracle, or MySQL) - Pig experience desired. 2+ years work experience providing analytical insights and business reports to product or business functions. Experience in presenting insights to executive staff on a regular basis a plus. 2+ years work experience programming in Java or Python. 1+ years experience with Tableau, QlikView, Microstrategy, or other data visualization and BI dashboarding tools. 1+ years experience working with distributed computing platform and tools (Hadoop, Pig, Hive, Spark, etc.) Proficiency in Unix/Linux for automating processes with shell scripting. Experience with R or other statistical package. Strong interest in working with Big Data, and making it accessible for the broader organization. Highly Productive : Ability to choose between competing technology solutions to find the right solution for the problem at hand. The ideal candidate will approach all problems with a holistic view toward future enhancements, ease of maintainability and leverage of emerging technologies. Strong Programming Skills: Success in this role requires hands-on work analyzing data captured from our products using a combination of Hive, Pig, Java, Python, and SQL, executed in our Hadoop framework. Prototyping metrics necessitates mastery of visualization tools like Tableau. Proven Communication Skills: This is a high-visibility role with direct exposure to our senior executives who are data-driven decision makers. Complex technical issues, actionable recommendations and their business impact must be stated concisely, both verbally and in writing. High-energy, Team-first, "Get it done" attitude : Must be motivated to work hard in a fast-paced environment to develop and track metrics for our company-wide Member Value Propositions, constructively accepting input from diverse stakeholders across the organization

description: Exponent is a leading engineering and scientific consulting firm. Our multidisciplinary team of scientists, engineers, physicians, and regulatory consultants brings together more than 90 different disciplines to solve complicated problems facing corporations, insurers, government entities, associations and individuals. Our approximately 900 staff members work in 26 offices across the United States and abroad. Exponent has over 700 consultants, including more than 425 that have earned a doctorate in their chosen field of specialization.  Exponent's Human Factors engineers and scientists evaluate human performance and safety in product and system use. Our consultants study how the limitations and capabilities of people, including memory, perception, reaction time, judgment, physical size and dexterity, affect the way they use a product or participate in an activity.  We have experience in the following areas of research: Evaluating human performance in a wide variety of applications including: driving cars, operating heavy machinery, working in industrial settings and interacting with various consumer products Applying principles of cognitive, developmental and industrial psychology (such as visual perception, attention, perception-response time, decision making and auditory perception) to real-world situations Identifying patterns of injuries and calculating the risk of injury for products or activities Conducting research with questionnaires, focus groups, interviews, and observations of people Measuring the performance of children and adults engaged in a variety of different tasks (e.g., ladder climbing, operating vehicle controls, using various forms of safety equipment) to quantify human capabilities and responses in real-world settings Developing safety information to be placed on products and in manuals  Exponent is seeking a User Experience Researcher for our Menlo Park, CA office, who will report to a Human Factors Managing Scientist in the Phoenix, AZ office. This position will be responsible for conducting user studies for major Bay Area clients and serving as project manager on a potentially large number of such engagements.  Additional responsibilities will include: Supporting a range of consulting activities that involve human factors in accidents and their prevention, including limitations of human perceptual, cognitive, and response capabilities Developing client contacts Working on multi-disciplinary projects Providing case management, data processing, and other project support Conducting research to obtain and review technical data, scientific literature, and standards Participating in the design and evaluation of warnings and safety information  The ideal candidate for this position has hands-on experience conducting user experience research or usability testing in a real-world setting, yet possesses a strong scientific background in the foundations of cognition, perception, and human decision-making. Candidates should furthermore be comfortable working in a professional engineering and scientific consulting environment that is quite distinct from the agency environment more typical of user experience research.  Qualifications for this position include: Master's degree or Ph.D. in Experimental or Cognitive Psychology, Human Computer Interaction or related fields 1-2 years of experience conducting usability studies Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as strong interpersonal skills Strong mathematical aptitude and proficiency with statistics Solid foundation in science of cognition, perception, and human decision making Consummate project management skills and ability to juggle multiple teams concurrently Must be assertive, a self-starter, and able to work with accuracy under pressure and/or deadlines  We are an Affirmative Action, Equal Employment Opportunity, Veterans and Disabled Employer.

description: -  40737  Description  Adobe is changing the world through digital experiences. Our digital media and digital marketing solutions empower businesses to make, manage, measure, and monetize content. We are aggressively innovating to enrich content creation and to reinvent how companies interact with their customers across every digital channel. Just look around you, our impact can be seen on virtually every screen, from TV and movies to digital magazines, to websites and mobile devices.  The challenge  We are looking for student interns with expertise in big data analytics for web, social and video. Our research includes building models of users' behavior from online experiences and identifying key factors that affect these behaviors. Other research involves the analysis of attribution modeling of influences on end-user behavior, churn prediction and propensity scoring. We are also exploring the opportunities of linking media activity to online digital marketing experiences. Ideal candidates will have a strong academic background as well as technical skills including MapReduce programming, statistics, machine learning, and data mining. Familiarity working with large-scale datasets (such as Twitter, blogs, Facebook, etc) would be a major plus.  What you’ll do   Performing analysis on big data from social media and web activity logs. Building predictive user models. MapReduce programming within Hadoop ecosystem -Create visual analytics or dashboard applications. What you need to succeed Strong communication skills; able to clearly articulate complex problems and solutions in terms that others can understand. Strong Java programming skills. Enrolled in a MS/PhD program in Computer Science or related technical field. Must have academic research experience in one of the following areas: Human-Computer Interaction, Data Mining, Information Retrieval, Information Visualization, or Machine Learning. description: USRA is an independent, nonprofit research corporation where the combined efforts of in-house talent and university-based expertise merge to advance space science and technology. USRA works across disciplines including bio medicine, planetary science, astrophysics, and engineering and integrates those competencies into applications ranging from fundamental research to facility management and operations. USRA engages the creativity and authoritative expertise of the research community to develop and deliver sophisticated, forward-looking solutions to Federal agencies and other customers - on schedule and within budget.  Under the lead of the Science Planning & Instrument Support lead and HAWC+ Instrument Scientist, the Visiting Post-Doctoral Scientist will support SOFIA far-infrared instrumentation, particularly HAWC+, science operations by supporting the instrument(s) and general investigators. The Visiting Post-Doctoral Scientist will also develop and pursue independent research relevant to SOFIA up to 50% time.  Duties and Responsibilities  Prepare and perform queue-based observations with SOFIA/far-infrared instrumentation, particularly HAWC+ for the user community  Responsible for monitoring instrument performance and status  Advise Science Operations and Science Data Processing management of required maintenance, changes and improvements for the assigned SOFIA far-infrared instrumentation, particularly HAWC+, hardware, instrument software and pipeline processing  Act as technical interface for the instrument to the user community and the SOFIA project, particularly pertaining to FIR polarimetry  Support the acquisition and analysis of Far-Infrared polarimetry  Assist in organizing and implementing the use and scientific optimization of SOFIA far-infrared instrumentation, particularly HAWC+, instrument on SOFIA  Active astronomical research relevant to SOFIA  Required Skills  PhD in Astronomy or Physics or related field  Two years of relevant experience a plus  Demonstrated experience in the acquisition and analysis of Far-Infrared astronomical polarimetry  Relevant experience is defined as experience in astronomical research, data reduction and development of science instruments and/or software for astronomical observations.  A cover letter should be submitted along with your resume in order to be considered for this position.  All interested candidates must apply directly on our website at https://usracareers.silkroad.com/ .  USRA is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity  Required Experience

We have excellent Benefits, which includes a 401k match.JOB DESCRIPTIONThe Intelligent Robotics Group conducts an aggressive program of robotics research and development. Research topics include on-­?board rover autonomy and resource management, planetary surface rover development, real-­? time computer vision based control of mobile robots and manipulators, human-­?robot interaction, and 3D terrain reconstruction and visualization. This research and development supports a wide variety of NASA enterprise customers through direct technology delivery, as well as through a program of field-­?testing of technologies in remote science analog environments and on the International Space Station.The NASA Ames Intelligent Robotics Group (irg.arc.nasa.gov) has an immediate opening for a talented software developer to help create advanced 3D teleoperation and visualization interfaces. description: Merck & Co., Inc. Kenilworth, N.J., U.S.A. known as Merck in the United States and Canada, is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company – one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us.  Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of an individual like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.  We are looking for a talented protein purification and analytical biochemist to purify and carry out extensive characterization of recombinant proteins and monoclonal antibodies expressed within the Protein Sciences Department at Merck Palo Alto.  Candidates should have hands on experience in protein purification.  Candidates must be knowledgeable in protein purification, analytical, and biophysical characterization methods such as HPLC (SEC, IEX, RP), capillary electrophoresis, cIEF, dynamic and static light scattering, DSC. Experience with high-throughput analytical methods is a plus  Strong hands-on experience in troubleshooting and routine instrument maintenance. description: SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory is seeking an Associate Staff Scientist or Staff Scientist to join the Coherent X-ray imaging Department of the Linac Coherent Light Source (LCLS) Directorate. LCLS the world's first hard x-ray free electron laser is ideal to study ultrafast processes in matter and utilize the femtosecond x-ray pulses for structural biology studies beyond the classical x-ray pulse tolerance limit. The Associate Staff Scientist or Staff Scientist will be a member of the Science, Research & Development (SRD) Division, whose mission is to ensure the success of experiments at the LCLS by operating, maintaining and upgrading the instrumentation. The successful candidate will become a member of the Coherent X-ray Imaging department and be involved in every day experiments as well as potential development of new instrumentation. Depending on interests and capabilities, the candidate could play a lead role in developing analysis tools for general purpose research or dedicated to structural biology, or lead the development of a new beamline at LCLS. The candidate will also have the opportunity to engage in other related scientific research efforts and develop new scientific objectives.   Specific Responsibilities including but not limited to the following:  Improve proficiency in the operation of LCLS instrumentation and user activities. Perform research and development to expand the capabilities of LCLS. Participate in planning and performing forefront experiments in ultrafast X-ray science and structural biology using the LCLS. Collaborate with other instrument scientists, engineers and technical staff to execute planned experiments. Disseminate research results through peer reviewed publications and presentations at scientific meetings. Note: This position is posted at the Associate Staff Scientist and Staff Scientist levels. The Associate Staff Scientist position is a 3 to 5 year fixed term position and is the entry level in the Staff Scientist career path. Appointment to the Staff Scientist level, a regular-continuing position, requires a review and evaluation of documented scientific achievements.   Qualifications:  Ph.D. in Physics, Applied Physics, Chemistry, Biology or related field with post-doctoral experience. Strong background in synchrotron radiation or Free-Electron Laser techniques and instrumentation, with emphasis in structural biology, hard X-ray crystal diffraction and or coherent diffractive imaging. Demonstrated ability to develop, design and test new scientific instrumentation. Demonstrated record of scientific productivity through publications. Strong analytical and computation skills. Demonstrated organizational skills and ability to multi-task and complete assignments. Effective communication and writing skills to prepare and present technical and scientific documentation. Demonstrated ability to carry out independent research, collaborate closely with colleagues conducting experimental research, and participate in the writing of scientific proposals to fund research. Demonstrated ability to work independently and in a team environment. Demonstrated ability to work and communicate effectively with a diverse population. Experience in one or more of the following required: Experience with data processing and data analysis for large data sets. Experience with x-ray structural biology data analysis and data interpretation. Specific experience with analysis of Coherent Diffractive Imaging data. Specific experience with analysis of Serial Femtosecond Crystallography data. Background in x-ray optics and beamline design Experience with optical lasers Qualifications:

description: As a member of a fast-paced multi-disciplinary team, you use your creativity and diverse range of engineering experience to explore solutions to a variety of engineering problems. As a mechanical engineer, you participate in the design, analysis, and prototyping of new concepts. You work in a manufacturing and product oriented development environment and collaborate with vendors and outside sources in order to see parts through to manufacture.  Our project is seeking to fill a mechanical engineering position, focused on the development of agile, high-accuracy and compact optical beam steering mechanisms. The scope of responsibilities include collaborating closely with controls systems, optics and opto-mechanical engineers on the team to rapidly prototype beam steering mechanisms that operate in harsh environmental conditions, as well as evaluate the performance of existing prototypes. You're a highly-motivated individual that enjoys working in a small dynamic team environment. Responsibilities  Design high-accuracy coarse and fine pointing assemblies that can steer optical beams.  Evaluate performance and troubleshooting of existing coarse-pointing prototypes.  Design assemblies that maintain compliance with operational requirements over a wide thermal range.  Conduct finite-element and modal analysis.  Provide environmental (thermal, structural, EMI, etc.) test preparation, setup and data analysis.  Minimum Qualifications  BS degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.  4 years of relevant work experience. Experience with designing agile, light-weight, compact and high-accuracy pointing mechanisms, with potentially multiple stages (e.g., coarse pointing and fine pointing).  Experience in finite-element analysis to evaluate thermally-induced stresses and structural modes.  Experience in one of the mainstream 3D mechanical engineering CAD software programs.  Preferred Qualifications  MS degree in Mechanical Engineering.  5 years of relevant work experience.  Experience with opto-mechanical systems as well as control systems.  Hands-on experience with environmental testing infrastructure (e.g., thermal chambers, shake tables, etc.)  Familiarity with tooling and processes for volume production of hardware.  Familiarity with passive isolation, stray-light elimination, and protective structures against impact forces.  Area  X is a moonshot factory where uncomfortably ambitious, potentially world-changing new ideas such as self-driving cars, balloon-powered Internet and smart contact lenses are developed and taken out into the world. X projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a radically better place. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x].

description: Be part of a cell biology team advancing regenerative medicine therapies for CNS diseases.   SanBio is seeking a talented Scientist II to play an important role in the company’s scientific and clinical programs. This position will work with a small team of dedicated neuro- and cell biologists to generate gene expression profiling data instrumental in characterizing the company’s regenerative cell-based product, as well as in discovering its mechanisms of action. The candidate is expected to possess a strong quantitative and analytical background, and demonstrate experience with the use of commercial and open-source bioinformatics software and open-source databases. The candidate should also possess hands-on laboratory experience and familiarity with classical molecular biology techniques (such as RNA, DNA purification and quantification, tissue or cell sample preparation, qPCR, gel electrophoresis, etc)   Independence, leadership, creativity, strong analytical skills, and attention to details are qualities necessary to excel in this position.   This scientist will be responsible for generating microarray data, data mining, building the database, interpreting results, designing and conducting follow up studies, monitoring scientific literature and bringing new technologies in house, as well as communicating findings to the team.   Information and details can be found on the Company website and via the following link to scientific publications:  http://www.san-bio.com  http://www.san-bio.com/news/publications.php   Essential Job Functions and responsibilities:  • Identify best methodologies and vendors for conducting gene/miRNA expression profiling studies.  • Prepare and manage sample submissions  • Analyze and interpret results  • Conduct statistical analyses  • Prepare visual presentations of data  • Conduct validation studies using qRT-PCR  • Design and conduct follow up in-depth studies of pathways.  • Identify technology that is worth bringing in house to efficiently conduct testing of preclinical samples.  • Monitor scientific literature and plan, discuss and implement new experiments and procedures.  • Provide supervision, training, and assistance to others when needed.   Requirements  • PhD in Biological Sciences or Computational Biology with strong quantitative background, involving the analysis of large scale complex data such as next generation sequencing, microarrays, etc., with at least 2 years of experience, or Master’s degree with at least 10 years of experience.  • The ideal candidates will have solid background in biology/molecular biology, bioinformatics and statistics  • Candidate must be able to effectively interpret the analysis results within biological context.   Additional requirements include:  • Proficient with tools and open source software related to data analysis such as gene expression, pathway identification, variants calling, copy number variation identification, structural variants identification, gene fusion, allele specific gene expression, novel transcripts, etc.   SanBio offers a competitive base and incentive compensation package. The Company provides an array of benefits to promote a healthy and creative work environment for its team members. SanBio is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description: Geomagical Labs is an early-stage technology startup in the SF Bay Area, applying novel computer vision technologies to mass-scale consumer applications. We are looking for an imaginative, hands-on computer scientist, with a background in Visual SLAM, to lead the R&D; of our novel smartphone visual SLAM engine. Ideal candidates will be highly-motivated applied researchers with excellent hands-on development skills, entrepreneurial drive, and enthusiasm to develop amazing software used by millions of people. Candidates should have practical experience with keyframe and filtering-based visual SLAM systems, experience with inertial sensor kinematics, and solid understanding of multiple view geometry. This position requires strong theoretical foundations, excellent software development skills, sound scientific method, and an adventurous outlook.  Requirements:  Strong computer science foundations, with focus on vision and/or robotics (M.S./Ph.D. strongly preferred). Enthusiastic about seed-stage startups; entrepreneurial, comfortable with risk & uncertainty Hands-on experience developing visual SLAM systems for robotics, vision or AR applications Experience using inertial IMU data (gyros & accelerometers) in SLAM systems Familiar with multiple SLAM approaches, including keyframe BA and probabilistic filtering Solid applied math skills in linear algebra, 2D/3D geometry, and linear & non-linear optimization. Strong software development skills in Linux environments Significant hands-on experience with computer vision feature-level fundamentals (feature detection, correspondence matching, and tracking) Real-time software experience desired Mobile app development experience desired (iOS, Android) U.S. work visa is strongly desired - We will sponsor H1-B visas for candidates, but given visa uncertainty, we strongly prefer candidates to have an existing U.S. work visa.  Benefits:  Rare opportunity to join an early tech startup adventure when it is less than ten people. Be part of the core team responsible for inventing and productizing influential new technologies. Substantial stock equity packages, of the sort only available to early startup employees. We are located in Mountain View, California, but we have technical staff located around the globe. We prefer local candidates. but are open to remote work/telecommuting or part-time consulting for the right candidate.

description: As part of a programs team within the Google Apps for Work Demand Management organization, you will play a critical role in building an even stronger outbound sales development organization. Our mantra in Demand Management is “Engage. Inspire. Accelerate” which describes not only to how we want to connect with and serve our clients, but also to how we want to connect with and serve our sales development representatives and demand management representatives on our global team.  You will identify and execute a range of complex projects, including managing ongoing programs to help our global sales development representatives spend more quality time with prospective customers, ultimately helping our sales teams to achieve our aggressive growth objectives. With your strategic problem solving skills, and deft interpersonal communication style, you will work fluidly across disparate functional teams (Marketing, Sales, Systems, Sales Operations, etc.) to solve big, ambitious (and ambiguous) challenges to help our organization work smarter, faster and more effectively.  These efforts will range from innovative efforts such as coordinating with a team of data scientists to harness the power of machine learning and predictive analytics helping our representatives target the right accounts, to more foundational efforts such as building actionable business intelligence dashboards, and from deploying sales training certifications, to driving core strategy decisions with cross-functional directors and VPs.  Highly creative, curious, driven, analytical and detail oriented, you are the kind of person who paradoxically never has time to pursue all of your passions, interests and the opportunities you see, but at the same time you ruthlessly prioritize and tightly manage time to do cool things that really matter. Responsibilities  Collaborate with Google for Work Demand Management, Sales, Marketing and Operations teams (from front-line representatives to senior stakeholders) to help build a highly productive global demand management team.  Manage and lead projects across multiple stakeholders and educate stakeholders on style and guidelines for projects.  Develop processes and tools to tightly manage ongoing business operations (including campaign reporting definitions and data views, operational expense management, Objectives and Key Results (OKR) governance, internal and external communication, and recognition/reward programs, etc.).  Present management with clear insights and recommendations into drivers of business growth, Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), market trends, risks and opportunities leading to identification of new business opportunities and business growth-enhancing actions.  Build training and ongoing development programs and certifications to help our representatives become masters of their craft.  Minimum Qualifications  BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.  5 years of experience in sales, marketing, project management, consulting or business development at a high-tech company.  5 years of experience in reporting, data analysis and data visualization.  Preferred Qualifications  Experience and demonstrated ability to plan, execute and manage sales development and marketing campaigns.  Experience with Salesforce.com, SQL, Google Apps Script, JavaScript or HTML.  Demonstrated organizational and project management capabilities and ability to manage multiple tasks with shifting priorities and varying deadlines.  Analytical, with a track record of translating analysis and insights into actionable business plans.  Ability to understand complex systems and data structures, and translate that complexity in a simple, concise way to stakeholders.  Area  We've helped millions of employees and organizations around the world to "go Google." As masters of cloud computing, the Google for Work team helps small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies discover the wonders of "the cloud" and work smarter. Our technical and sales teams design and implement solutions for these organizations with custom features, security and support -- all with Google's philosophy of innovation and ease of use in mind.
jobtitle: Global Demand Management, Project Manager, Google Apps for Work

description: We are looking for a talented Senior level Optical Researcher and Scientist to generate fundamental research into next generation Light Field optical design and support the productization of new Light Field optics and systems. This person will have a major impact on the company’s success by performing research, design and analysis of critical optical systems that enable revolutionary Light Field capture. He/she will leverage their extensive knowledge of optics to collaborate with computational imaging researchers within Lytro to create new optical solutions that provide significant value to the imaging world.   Main Responsibilities: Perform fundamental research into Light Field optics hardware, leveraging computational advantages into revolutionary new optical solutions. Drive complex optical design, modeling and tolerance analysis for still image and video capture systems. Perform all necessary design and modeling tasks and presents data during internal and external design reviews. Collaborate closely with software, hardware and product teams specifying by selecting and qualifying active and passive optical components, developing and benchmarking system. performance models, developing and implementing test procedures and/or evaluating and selecting appropriate test. Design new optics solutions and specification/modification of off-the-shelf components to support new product development efforts. Work closely with lens suppliers to prototype and refine your designs into revolutionary products. Design and build complex measurement setups as required; perform measurements and data analysis; compile and present data. Establish and develop collaborative engineering relationships with internal customers. Assist Business Development and Engineering teams through consultation on outside system designs to secure new business. Mentor and train optical engineers and technicians. Requirements: Ph.D. in Optics or Physics with an emphasis in Imaging Systems. Extensive experience (10 + years minimum) and demonstrated expertise in optical research into and design of complex imaging systems. Experience with multi-element imaging lens experience highly preferred. Experience managing/working with lens suppliers to realize new and future forward designs. description: The Instrumentation Software Engineer will be responsible for developing software for Picarro's innovative gas analysis instrumentation, to be used by scientists and industry professionals world-wide. We are looking for a creative scientist with extensive programming experience, who understands the challenges of interfacing software and instrumentation hardware robustly; who knows how to design powerful, intuitive, and reliable user interfaces; who is adept at managing, analyzing, and displaying large amounts of scientific data; and who is capable of developing a deep understanding Picarro’s core technology and the hybrid hardware / software algorithms that run on the instruments. The Instrumentation Software Engineer will work closely with Picarro's team of scientists and engineers to develop new products and expand the capability of existing products.  The Instrumentation Software Engineer must:  Develop highly functional and robust software that reflects a deep understanding of Picarro’s laser-based Cavity Ring-Down Spectroscopy technology. Understand the software development life cycle – including planning, developing, troubleshooting, documenting, integrating, and analyzing software applications. Work closely with project managers, engineering, research and development, marketing, manufacturing and technical support. Must be able to understand software requests, acquire specifications, manage project scopes, and provide fast and accurate solutions.  Minimum Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree or higher in Physics, Chemistry, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field, with Masters or Ph.D. desirable. Minimum 3 years of experience in data acquisition software development, data processing and analysis, control algorithm design, and/or data visualization. Solid object-oriented programming skills in Python Experience creating software to interface with scientific instruments and/or test equipment Background in scientific data processing and statistical analysis Experience in developing algorithms for controlling and monitoring physical systems Strong teamwork and communication skills Strong analytical, debugging, and problem-solving skills Proactive, creative, fast-paced, and quality-oriented  Related Skills and Experience:  Experience in software modeling and simulation for engineering applications Experience in elegant, intelligent, and reusable high-level design techniques Fluency in version control processes and software tools. Experience with embedded system design desirable  Picarro is revolutionizing human understanding of the global carbon, water and nitrogen cycles - essentially the building blocks of all life on Earth - by providing analytical instrumentation, systems and advanced services that are opening incredible new opportunities in diverse markets related to science, environment, energy and food.  With ultra-precise, easy-to-use and portable gas concentration and stable isotope analysis instruments, integrated with powerful geo-informatics and geo-spatial visualizations, we are empowering scientists, businesses, governments and NGOs with specific, comprehensive and actionable environmental data – at unprecedented speed, scale and simplicity.  We are marketing our scientific instruments, associated products and technologies into three application segments, helping our customers solve pressing global problems in air, water and land.   Air: Customers use Picarro technology to do critical research on the changing composition of the atmosphere and the air we breathe. We put new tools and information in the hands of scientists, regulators, industry and government stakeholders to enable research in the fields of climate change, urban air pollution and emissions. Water: Picarro enables fundamental research into the water cycle, one of the most critical resources for sustaining life on earth, for the past, present and future. Land: Efficient use of soil, nutrients and water resources are amongst the most important objectives of our global society. Picarro technologies allow scientists to quantify the flux of gases from soils, monitor carbon storage and host of other applications.  Our products are used in a wide variety of applications, including: Earth sciences research; air quality, greenhouse gas and fugitive emissions measurements, energy exploration and distribution, and supply chain integrity. Deployed on all seven continents in places as diverse as the Greenland Ice Cap, The Eiffel Tower, NASA aircraft and Pacific Gas & Electric’s natural gas leak detection vehicles, our solutions are unparalleled in their precision, ease of use, portability and reliability. Our products are all designed and manufactured at our Santa Clara, California, U.S.A. headquarters and exported to countries worldwide. Our technology is based on dozens of patents related to cavity ring-down spectroscopy (CRDS). Investors include Benchmark Capital, DAG Ventures, Focus Ventures, Greylock Partners, Mingxin China Growth Fund and NTT Finance.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, gender identity, secual orientation, or on the basis of disability.  Posted positions are not open to third party recruiters/agencies and unsolicited resume submissions will be considered free referrals.

description: The self-driving car project aims to improve people’s lives by transforming mobility and making it easier and safer for everyone to get around, regardless of their ability to drive. So far, we’ve self-driven over 1 million miles and are currently out on the streets of Mountain View, California and Austin, Texas.  As a Systems Engineer, you will help revolutionize the safety and efficiency of personal mobility as part of a team developing self-driving cars. You will help us build the right products and rigorously stress those products so they do not fail our customers. Responsibilities  Identify, document, and organize planning and prediction requirements that are useful to implementing engineers, and that form the basis of a robust test program.  Work with software team to architect the planning and prediction systems, and their interactions with other subsystems. Define the key interfaces.  Perform trade studies to inform design decisions.  Define how the planner and prediction team knows their software is "done", that it is safe for a given environment. Track progress toward completion, and suggest priorities for accelerating progress. This includes identifying, prioritizing, and designing mitigations for technical risks.  Develop test approaches and software and hardware tools to efficiently exercise these systems, and provide easily-understood feedback to developers. Develop specific test procedures and analyze test results.  Minimum Qualifications  BS degree in Computer Science, Robotics, Controls, or equivalent practical experience.  Experience figuring out how to make systems fail in ways that help engineers improve their designs.  Experience with high-performance engineering and operations team, including developing consensus in the face of technical disagreements.  Data analysis skills (e.g. matplotlib or MATLAB).  Preferred Qualifications  Graduate degree in Computer Science, Robotics, Controls, or equivalent experience.  Experience on engineering teams.  Experience designing, implementing, and/or testing complex multidisciplinary systems and/or safety-critical systems.  Linux proficiency. Python and C++ programming skills.  Careful and detailed approach to safety-related planning, testing, and documentation.  High social intelligence, and a sense of humor.  Area  X is a moonshot factory where uncomfortably ambitious, potentially world-changing new ideas such as self-driving cars, balloon-powered Internet and smart contact lenses are developed and taken out into the world. X projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a radically better place. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x].

description: Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.  The UX (User Experience) Team at Project Aura develops concepts, designs, user interfaces, user experiences, input and output devices, and interaction techniques. We are a highly motivated team that works in a fast paced environment. We prototype with paper, clay, screens, video, software and hardware, depending on the needs. We work both with near-term products to support and inform product decision, as well as, with experiments, explorations, and longer term R&D; efforts. We have a diverse team of UX/UI/sound/motion/product designers, interaction/UX researchers, software engineers, UX prototypers and research scientists. Not only is our team very interdisciplinary, we also work closely and organically, for example, with industrial design, product design engineering, mechanical engineering, optics, marketing and the software and hardware teams.  As a Software Engineer in our UX team, you will have a critical role in synthesizing concepts into functional prototypes of different fidelity. We’d like you to bring the most innovative product concepts to life to help us push the boundaries of user interface design across a new category of products.  You'll partner with our designers, researchers and engineers to define and deliver new features, test new concepts and assist with final implementation. You work both independently and collaboratively in your projects, and will interface members across the organization. You will use your experience to drive medium to large-sized tasks and projects while exercising considerable independent judgment and discretion. Responsibilities  Deliver innovative, engaging prototypes using the latest software technologies.  Design and build advanced apps for the Android platform.  Advise, collaborate with, and synthesize feedback from UX designers and researchers, and members from across the organization.  Fulfill several project requests simultaneously while meeting tight deadlines.  Assist software and hardware engineers with final development of Aura products.  Minimum Qualifications  BA/BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.  Experience with developing apps with streamlined UI/UX.  Experience in mobile application development.  Preferred Qualifications  MS degree in Computer Science with 5 years of related work experience.  Experience working with Android SDKs (sensors), third-party APIs and data sources (JSON/XML, etc.).  Experience with low-level Android development (NDK).  Embedded development and prototyping (microcontrollers, FPGAs) experience.  C/C++ experience, especially for firmware development.  Proven ability to collaborate with designers, researchers, and engineers to develop new solutions.  Area  The Google Glass division is a world-class team focused on the cutting edge of hardware, software and industrial design. It is charged with pioneering, developing, building and launching smart eyewear and other related products in line with Google's ambitious and visionary objectives.
jobtitle: Software Prototyping Engineer, Project Aura, Glass and Beyond

description: The Department of Pediatrics, Division of Neonatal and Developmental Medicine at Stanford University School of Medicine aims to provide optimum state-of-the-art care for critically ill and recovering neonates and infants. We are dedicated to the School of Medicine’s mission of advancing and exploring innovative and novel biomedical, translational, and clinical research and education through the nurturing stimulation of interactions among basic and clinical scientists, clinicians, and educators throughout the School of Medicine and University, as well as with the private and public sectors. Through our integrated research, education, patient, and community outreach programs, we are committed to maintaining the highest standards of academic medicine and patient care. Embedded in the Division are the Perinatal Programs.   About the Perinatal Programs:  Stanford University is the coordinating center for the California Perinatal Quality Care Collaborative (CPQCC) and California Maternal Quality Care Collaborative (CMQCC). CPQCC provides leadership from within our Outcomes and Perinatal Epidemiology Research Unit and helps facilitate statewide collaboration. The collaborative collects data from 132 NICUs to identify opportunities for improving the quality of care for the 6,000 yearly acute neonatal transports. CPQCC’s sister program, CMQCC, works to ensure equitable care for mothers to end preventable morbidity, mortality, and racial disparities in California maternal care. The Mid-Coastal California Perinatal Outreach Program (MCCPOP) provides obstetrical and neonatal education, resources, consultation, and technical assistance to regional healthcare providers. The Regional Perinatal Programs of California (RPPC) is a cooperative network of public and private health care providers within geographic areas who focus on the well-being of pregnant women and their babies to promote access to appropriate levels of high quality care. Together, these Perinatal programs focus on improving the quality of maternal and newborn care and outcomes.   We are currently recruiting for 3 Biostatistician II positions who will consult with investigators to refine research questions, define hypotheses, design studies and devise analysis plans, work with senior statistician(s) to implement analysis plans and publish findings, and present results orally to clinical investigators. These positions will provide guidance to clinical investigators on design and analysis issues.   These positions will focus on different research projects associated with the following programs within the Perinatal group:   1) California Children’s Services (CCS) High Risk Infant Follow-up (HRIF) Program (Job #69900)  2) CMQCC (Job #68941)  3) CPQCC (Job #69596)   Duties include:   • Design study.  • Develop and implement protocol for quality control.  • Create analytic files with detailed documentation.  • Select appropriate statistical tools for addressing a given research question.  • Implement data analysis through statistical programming.  • Present results for investigators using graphs and tables.  • Summarize findings orally and in written form.  • Participate in the preparation of papers for publication.  • Consult with investigators on appropriate statistical approaches to data analyses; assist in study design and proposal development.  • Mentor collaborators in areas of experimental design, quality control, and statistical analysis  • Develop oral and written dissemination of findings for conference presentations and peer-reviewed journal articles.  • Oversee lower-level staff on issues related to quality control and creation of analysis files.   * - Other duties may also be assigned Requirements DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:  • Ph.D. in Biostatistics preferred  • Experience working with complex, large scale data sets, including data cleaning, security, selection of software, quality control, documentation and data reports.  • 5 to 10 years of experience in managing, analyzing, and reporting on large datasets desired   EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE (REQUIRED):   Master's degree in biostatistics, statistics or related field and at least 3 years of experience.   KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES (REQUIRED):   • Proficient in at least two of R, SAS, SPSS, or STATA.  • Skills in descriptive analysis, modeling of data, and graphic interfaces.  • Outstanding ability to communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical audiences.  • Demonstrated excellence in at least one area of expertise, which may include coordinating studies; statistical methodology such as missing data, survival analysis, statistical genetics, or informatics; statistical computing; database design (e.g., expertise in RedCAP or MySQL); graphical techniques (e.g., expertise in Illustrator).   PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:   • Frequently perform desk based computer tasks, seated work and use light/ fine grasping.  • Occasionally stand, walk, and write by hand, lift, carry, push pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.   * - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.   May work extended or non-standard hours based on project or business cycle needs.   If you are interested in applying for these positions, please visit stanfordcareers.stanford.edu and search for job #s 69900, 68941, and 69596. Resume and cover letter required.   Stanford University is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and is committed to recruiting and hiring qualified women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

description: You will choose what technical challenges you want to solve, including: design and architecture of components handling terabytes of data per day, working with modern distributed databases and computation systems, processing and analysis of almost a petabyte of data.  Named #8 on Forbes 2015 America's Most Promising Companies list, AppLovin's marketing platform provides marketing automation and analytics for brands who want to reach their consumers on mobile. The platform enables brands to use real-time data signals to make effective marketing decisions across one billion mobile consumers worldwide. AppLovin has over 85 employees and is headquartered in Palo Alto, with offices in San Francisco, New York, London, and Berlin.  The Palo Alto team comprises of smart, passionate engineers and data scientists who tackle challenging problems to scale mobile advertising to billions of users daily. We use Java, C++, Redis, Scala, Spark, Aerospike, Vertica, PHP, Chef, Jenkins, Github.  Requirements:  2+ years of professional experience You love to program, solve problems and build stuff Have advanced knowledge of Java and concurrency Have experience working with big data systems (Spark, Hadoop, Pig, Impala, Kafka) Have experience working with no-SQL databases (Mongo, Redis, Aerospike, Cassandra) Have a minimum of a BS and/or MS in Computer Science  Perks:  Free medical, dental, and vision insurance Daily lunches and fully stocked kitchen Free public transit Free laundry service (wash/dry clean) Free gym membership Stock Options & 401k matching Fun company parties and events Autonomy to make decisions in a rapidly growing company Unlimited vacation policy - work hard and take time when you need it  Interested? Send us your resume and let's talk!

description: Merck & Co., Inc. Kenilworth, N.J., U.S.A. known as Merck in the United States and Canada, is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company – one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us.  Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of an individual like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.  The Department of Profiling and Expression at Merck Research Laboratories, Palo Alto, is seeking an experienced researcher at the Principal Scientist level to support applied immuno-oncology research and biomarker development for evaluations of candidate biological pharmaceuticals. The position will require extensive experience in immunohistochemistry (IHC), in situ hybridization, immunofluorescence (IF) including multiplexed applications, and confocal microscopy. Practical experience with digital imaging equipment such as the Aperio Scanscope XT and FL, the PerkinElmer Vectra system, and/or similar systems, as well as a high level of comfort and facility with quantitative image analysis software tools such as ImageJ, Definiens Developer, HALO, and/or MatLab, is required. The position will require independent management of complex and challenging projects, interfacing effectively with multiple functional areas, and supervising/mentoring PhD level staff.  The successful candidate will: Develop and validate image analysis methodologies and algorithms for quantitation of single-plex and multiplexed IHC and IF for disparate analytes in human tissues, and supervise execution of same by junior level staff  Apply analytic methods to multiparametrically phenotype cells, and to quantitate and spatially characterize molecular targets in situ within tissue sections  Take on a leadership role in evaluation of cutting-edge, highly multiplexed quantitative platforms, and the technology needed internally to yield the most robust, extensive data sets from small amounts of sample material  Interact well and smoothly with pathologists, IHC bench scientists, and histotechnicians in workflows for projects with quantitative imaging endpoints.  Serve as a representative of the Anatomic Pathology group and a functional area expert on project and strategy teams  Present data in team meetings and participate in generation of technical reports in support of regulatory documents.  This position will require a high level of comfort with complex multitasking; strong self-motivation; the ability to work independently; excellent communication skills, including written communication; excellent interpersonal skills; and a highly collaborative approach  Qualifications  Education: Minimum of PhD (biology, biochemistry, immunology or related field strongly preferred)  Required: Minimum of 10 years relevant post-doctoral experience  Minimum of 3 years of experience in the pharmaceutical industry  Extensive experience with immunohistochemistry  Extensive experience with quantitative image analysis using multiparametric algorithms  Preferred: High level of comfort with histology/microanatomy strongly preferred  Background in immunology  Supervisory experience with an interest in mentoring junior staff  Previous experience with biologics  Our employees are the key to our company’s success. We demonstrate our commitment to our employees by offering a competitive and valuable rewards program. Our Company’s benefits are designed to support the wide range of goals, needs and lifestyles of our employees, and many of the people that matter the most in their lives. If you need an accommodation for the application process please email us at staffingaadar@merck.com.  Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully: Merck & Co., Inc. is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Merck via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Merck. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Merck as a result of the referral or through other means.  Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.  For more information about personal rights under Equal Employment Opportunity, visit:  EEOC Poster  EEOC GINA Supplement?  Merck is an equal opportunity employer, Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran – proudly embracing diversity in all of its manifestations.  Job  :  Biology-Discovery  Job Title  :  Prin. Scientist, Biology-Discovery  Primary Location  :  NA-US-CA-Palo Alto  Employee Status  :  Regular  Travel  :  No  Number of Openings  :  1  Shift (if applicable)  :  1st  Hazardous Materials  :  standard pathology laboratory chemicals such as neutral buffered formalin, xylene, ethanol. description: -  43382  Description  Our company  At Adobe, we’re changing the world. How? We give people the tools to bring their ideas to life and create content that makes life more fun and work more meaningful. We give businesses and organizations the power to truly engage their customers. We're the ones behind the gorgeously designed content that streams across your laptop, TV, phone, and tablet every day—and we’re the ones who harness the massive power of big data to help companies move from data to insight and insight to action by delivering content that people crave most.  We’re a company that understands that product innovation comes from people innovation, and that’s why we invest in  cultivating leaders  throughout the organization. If you’re passionate about leading from where you sit, join us.  The challenge  The candidate will work in a team of machine learning scientists and developers to create new models, improve existing ones and also to implement, prototype, scale, test and validate these models and algorithms.  What you’ll do  Analyzing live and historic data to provide insights to the data set  Researching, prototyping and implementing new models and algorithms  Cooperating and collaborating with other teams across Adobe on common project  Validating and Testing Models and Algorithms  Working with consultants and customers to help them with their problems  What you need to succeed  M.S. or Ph.D. in CS, Math, Stats, or related fields  Comprehensive knowledge of machine learning/data mining and knowledge of statistics  Experience in specialized areas such as Recommendation Systems, Forecasting and Optimization is a plus  Strong programming skills including experience in Java and other object-oriented programming (C++, Python, …)  Experience with large data sets and related technologies, e.g., Hadoop, Spark  Experience with SQL, R, Matlab  Excellent communications skills  Strong academic publication record is a plus  Making our technology accessible to all  We believe everyone should have equal access to technology and its benefits. To help achieve this, Adobe is focused on making software more accessible for everyone. When we hire for engineering, development and design roles, we look for the following accessibility skills:  Base knowledge of the W3C’s Web Content Accessibility Guidelines v2.0  Exposure to current tools used by people with disabilities (screen readers and other assistive technologies)  Experience with accessibility evaluation and validation software  Understanding of input and output modes used by people with disabilities  Familiarity with compliance requirements - state, Federal, international  At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on  Best Companies lists  . You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique  Check-In  approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.  If you’re looking to grow your career  , Adobe’s the place for you.  Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences through the  Adobe Life magazine  .  Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.  Job  Development  Primary Location  Americas-USW-San Jose (Headquarters)  Schedule  Full-time

description: Do you wish that your work had a more direct impact on people? Are you excited about the potential of human genetics to make a real difference in the world? At 23andMe, we believe that we are one the cusp of huge advances in genetics, and that our unique database of over one million genotypes and over two hundred fifty million phenotype data points gives us an incredible opportunity to advance biomedical research and make discoveries about the genetics of complex disease. We are looking for a colleague with extensive training and experience in statistical genetics to join our highly productive, world-class research team. The successful candidate will work within and across teams to support our research efforts. The job requires strong statistics, computational skills, biological insight, and excellent writing. An ability to ask and understand the “so what” aspect of any finding is critical. Candidates for the senior statistical geneticist role should also have multiple years of experience playing a leadership role in genetic association studies and executing independently-developed ideas, as well as a demonstrated ability to communicate clearly and effectively with a wide range of audiences. See our recent publications here: https://www.23andme.com/for/scientists/ Responsibilities Design and execute a wide range of analyses for both internal and external customers. Work collaboratively with members of the research, product, and engineering teams to develop our research platform. For senior scientists: supervise, develop, and mentor junior scientists. Manage teams to execute complex projects. Requirements  Ph.D. in Statistics, Genetics, or a related field. Strong statistical skills. Research experience in statistics and genetics. Hands-on experience working with very large data sets in Python or R; experience with C/C++ is a plus. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Enthusiasm for working in a highly collaborative environment. About Us 23andMe, Inc. is the leading personal genetics company. Our mission is to help people access, understand and benefit from the human genome. 23andMe has over 1 million customers worldwide with over 80 percent consented to participate in research. 23andMe, Inc. is located in Mountain View, CA. More information is available at www.23andMe.com.

Working with suppliers to incorporate your designs into systems built for KLA-Tencor. Must have a deep understanding of kinematics, dynamics and mechanical vibrations. Must be familiar with control system theory. Must be able to design and analyze complex mechanical assemblies. Must be familiar with SolidWorks or Pro/E. Must be able to perform simulations and analyze data using programs such as MatLab, Labview or Python. Must be a team player with good written and verbal communication skills. Experience designing capital equipment such as semiconductor manufacturing equipment is preferred.

description: On January 6, 2016 we announced that Netflix was available around the world. In one instant, we turned on the service in more than 130 countries simultaneously. However, simply making the service available is not the last step. All associated tools and solutions need to continue to evolve to address this global scale. One example is our marketing technology, where we are focused on cutting edge digital marketing efforts founded in automation, big data, testing and associated analytics.   As an engineer for our marketing technology platforms, you will contribute to these efforts with a broad base of skills including the ability to create tools, automate solutions and debug complex advertising execution issues. The role is a balance of architectural oversight combined with a penchant for finding problems and devising solutions.   The role spans the continuum of digital execution from cutting edge dynamic serving and buying platforms all the way to sophisticated front-end applications across desktop, video and mobile environments. If you have worked in digital advertising (a big bonus!) you understand how day-to-day tasks shift, the environment is dynamic and while the problems are difficult, the rewards are satisfying.   As part of the Ad Technology team within the Netflix Product Engineering organization, you will work directly with world-class talent from teams including: digital marketing, data science, platform engineering and finance to develop innovative solutions that improve and optimize Netflix digital marketing tactics.   We embrace our high performance culture so we’re looking for a history of outstanding accomplishment and a willingness to lead in the face of ambiguity. If you like to think big, move fast and build cutting edge solutions with outstanding colleagues, we’d like to talk with you.   About you:   Netflix’s culture is unique and we are seeking an equally unique individual who can thrive in this fast-paced and ever-evolving environment. Some traits you possess that would point toward success in the role:  You enjoy autonomy and thrive when challenged with creating definition out of ambiguity. You like variety, experimentation and challenging existing assumptions. You love working with a team that spans world-class engineers, scientists and digital marketers. When the tools and systems you use are sub-optimal, you are not content until you find a solution. Your express concepts -- both written and verbally -- with clarity and comprehensiveness. You possess tenacity, determination and are not intimidated by hard problems and new challenges. You like risk and are accountable when you fail (and we encourage you to innovate to the point of failure). Requirements:  3+ years of web-related experience in software development or devops in a large-scale production environment. Designing, developing and enhancing tools / solutions to automate data analysis and business insights (Java, Python, Pig, SQL, Kibana). Building / debugging front-end web solutions (JavaScript, HTML5, Pixel tracking). Implementing API solutions (REST, SOAP). Familiarity with relational and non relational database systems (Hive, Elasticsearch, Druid).Experience working in a Distributed/Cloud-based environment (Amazon EC2, Google Cloud Storage, etc.). Experience analyzing and processing log files, large data sets and related data visualization. Not required but nice to have:  Experience developing solutions for display or search advertising. Familiarity with the inefficiencies of the ad ops space and a desire to improve them. Experience working with elements of the digital advertising tech ecosystem: adserver (DoubleClick, Atlas etc.), DSPs, DMPs, bidded social buying, etc. Our culture is unique so it's worth determining if you are inspired by our values: Netflix Culture

description: Makani is working to make clean energy accessible for everyone by developing energy kites, a new type of wind turbine that can access stronger and steadier winds at higher altitudes to generate more energy with less materials. Makani is a part of X.  You will have the ability to manage a complex work package utilizing resources drawn across the Makani team. The ability to establish a constructive partnership with certification bodies is an essential requirement. Key problems to be solved include the identification of gaps in existing certification standards that provide challenges for energy kite systems, establishing new standards that address those gaps, the development and execution of a program to develop approved simulation capabilities, and the validation of the design and simulations using test data. You will need a strong engineering understanding of aerospace and/or wind energy systems coupled with excellent people skills and a focus on complex problem solving in a fast paced work environment.  Responsibilities  Develop a comprehensive plan for the certification of Makani energy kites.  Assure effective communication within the Makani team, tracking overall project progress and budget. Help the team identify gaps between predicted and desired schedules and reallocate resources accordingly.  Manage certification work packages within Makani.  Manage external partners that contribute to the overall certification program.  Support interactions with potential customers.  Minimum Qualifications  BS in Aerospace or Mechanical Engineering, or other relevant fields or equivalent practical experience.  10 years of work experience and 5 years of experience in project management in a relevant hardware environment.  Experience in certifying wind energy systems. Experience with certification processes.  Experience in the development of partnerships.  Preferred Qualifications  Advanced degree in Aerospace or Mechanical Engineering  Deep technical capability in wind energy, aviation, power systems or electromechanical design.  Expertise in wind energy simulation and loads calculation processes.  Excellent communication and people skills.  Able to travel up to 15% of time both domestically and internationally.  Area  X is a moonshot factory where uncomfortably ambitious, potentially world-changing new ideas such as self-driving cars, balloon-powered Internet and smart contact lenses are developed and taken out into the world. X projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a radically better place. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x].

description: Welcome  Who we are  Quantum Dot Pioneers  Management Team  Board of Directors  How It Works  Quantum Dots  QDEF  Environment  News  In The News  Press Releases  Awards  Photos & Video  Subscribe  Blog  Careers  Contact Us  Contact Us  Events  Welcome  Who we are  Quantum Dot Pioneers  Management Team  Board of Directors  How It Works  Quantum Dots  QDEF  Environment  News  In The News  Press Releases  Awards  Photos & Video  Subscribe  Blog  Careers  Contact Us  Contact Us  Events  R&D; Scientist, Cd Free Nanocrystal Synthesis  March 8, 2016  by Nanosys  Join the Quantum Dot Pioneers! Nanosys is building a materials revolution, combining scientific expertise with awareness of the system needs of TV and display manufacturers. We are looking for people who are not only energetic, committed and passionate about what they do, but focused on applying innovation to help industries overcome obstacles through materials architecture. We have a “roll-up your sleeves” culture that is based upon individual empowerment, mutual respect, integrity and recognition of successes. Our quantum dots are designed to increase the range of colors emitted by standard displays by up to 50% and that’s why we are interested in the color emitting characteristics of the semi-conductor materials we synthesize into fluorescent nanocrystals. Once created, the dots are coated onto a barrier film that we call QDEF, which in turn is added to a display during the manufacturing process. We are constantly developing new dots, looking at new methods of encapsulation and always pushing the R&D; envelope regarding the materials we design and manufacture. We have been very successful in developing the market for quantum dots in the display industry and we’ve been responsible for many breakthrough technological achievements. We are currently expanding our research activities and the successful candidate will play a key role in the development of our next generation Cadmium Free Quantum Dots (semiconductor nano-crystals) for display applications. R&D; Scientist, Cd Free Nanocrystal Synthesis #730 Summary of Essential Job Functions include but are not limited to the following: The primary responsibility for this position will be researching and coming up with innovative synthesis methodologies for Cd-free quantum dots aimed at improving their optical performance, reliability and ease of manufacture. This is a Laboratory (hands-on) position with some supervision of research associates and coordination with development partners. Chemical/ Inorganic synthesis of organometallics in air-free environments. Analytical characterization of organometallic precursors and quantum dots. Compile and present research data to the development team and make best case arguments for developing research programs. Keep excellent research notes and follow all best practice and GMP documentation guidelines.  Education, Experience and Certifications: PhD in Chemistry, Material Science or a similar discipline. Proven track record of innovative research in quantum dot synthesis. Experience working with Indium Phosphide (InP) or Cadmium (Cd) free Quantum Dot synthesis. Knowledge of organic ligand synthesis, polymerization and cross-linking reactions. Familiarity with nanocrystal characterization techniques (TEM, XRD, NMR, spectroscopy etc.). Experience with air-free chemistry techniques, including Schlenk techniques and working with glove boxes. Excellent communication skills both verbal and written and the ability to interact well in a team environment. Ability and desire to work efficiently and productively in a multi-task environment on a daily basis, independently and with minimal supervision.  Physical Demands & Work Environment: The physical demands and work environment described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Physical Demands include: walking, standing, sitting, use of hands or fingers to handle or feel, reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, talk and hear, lift up to 40 pounds, close vision (clear vision at 20 inches or less), distant vision (clear vision at 20 feet or more), color vision (ability to identify and distinguish colors), peripheral vision (ability to observe an area that can be seen up and down or to the left and right while eyes are fixed on a given point), Depth perception (three-dimensional vision, ability to judge distances and spatial relationships), ability to adjust focus (ability to adjust the eye to bring an object into sharp focus). Must be capable of climbing step stool to reach items at heights above 7 feet. Must be able to physically stand for up to one hour. Must be able to safely wear necessary personal protective equipment in designated areas i.e. lab coat, safety glasses. Must be able to respond to visual and audible alarms. Work is mainly performed in a laboratory environment. The noise level in the environment is usually moderate. While performing the duties of this job, the employee will work with toxic or caustic chemicals. Nanosys offers competitive salary with a wide range of benefits including a comprehensive health plan, basic life and AD&D;, short and long-term disability insurance, 401(k) savings plan, paid time off, paid holidays, employee referral program and stock options. We are seeking results-oriented people that are driven to succeed through teamwork, focused on discovery to solve real-world challenges, and passionate about building a new industry.
