description: Program Overview: This is a part-time position to supply programmatic support services to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Science and Technology Directorate (S&T;) Cyber Security Division (CSD) to support new initiatives including the DHS Silicon Valley Office (SVO), Aviation Cybersecurity, Cyber Physical Systems and Cyber.gov programs.  Responsibilities: Communications Tasks: In consultation with the SVO Program Director and SVO Senior Executive (CSD Division Director), develop and maintain the SVO Strategic Communications Plan (SCP), including but not limited to key messages, internal and external stakeholder communication methods and campaigns, schedules, and stakeholder lists  Develop, refine and maintain evaluation metrics as part of the SCP  Lead and carryout SVO communications tactics in consultation and coordination with the SVO Program Director, SVO Senior Executive (CSD Director), OCC and Office of Public Affairs (OPA), such as identifying outreach opportunities, developing press releases, developing social media campaigns, and brand development  Conceptualize, develop and maintain SVO marketing and communication materials in coordination with the Conference Management Office (CMO), OCC and OPA  Coordinate with OCC for all communication needs; such as routing of speaker request forms, interview coordination, social media, S&T; internal communication and branding development, website development and maintenance  Develop and edit content for the SVO website, articles, speeches, presentations and social media engagements and S&T; and HSARPA weekly reporting, as required and in accordance with applicable DHS rules and regulations  Coordinate the development of graphics and presentation material  Lead the planning, coordination and management of SVO events as needed; such as organizing planning meetings, maintaining agendas, coordinating key presenters and communicating with attendees  In consultation with the SVO Program Director and SVO Senior Executive (CSD Director), gather event requirements, conduct analysis and recommend solutions for SVO event and communications  Coordinate with the CMO conference team for planning logistics of events and requirements, as needed, including developing conference approval packages, conducting market research, developing project plans, and coordinating with contracted vendors  Assist with monitoring of event vendors and potential issues to ensure event remains on schedule and within budget  Develop the monthly SVO Communications Report for SVO Program Director and SVO Senior Executive (CSD Director) review and tracking  Contribute to the creation, maintenance and editing of SVO level documents including annual reports, strategies, fact sheets, one pagers, and SVO milestones  Provide input for the development of SVO briefings and presentations  Remain conversant in program details for discussion, both verbal and written, on SVO program, details of specific projects and processes for current and potential performers, customers, and program partners  Attend program and technical meetings as required  Coordinate with communications coordination activities carried out by the Washington DC-based Senior Business Operations Support  Administrative Tasks: Maintain organized and logical files for all necessary data calls, reports, program, and project documentation, including electronic and hard copy  Coordinate/organize program reviews, working group meetings, site visits, and technical workshops as needed and attend as required  Provide Silicon Valley meeting coordination support and handle logistics by obtaining necessary meeting materials and equipment, sending out invitations, reserving meeting space at S&T;, creating agendas, developing meeting materials, providing meeting summaries and after action reports and handle last- minute schedule changes  Work proactively to anticipate and prepare materials needed by the SVO Program Director and SVO Senior Executive (CSD Division Director) for meetings, appointments, correspondence, and telephone calls and follow-up on outstanding issues  Assist with preparation for, and conduct of, SVO meetings, events and activities  Develop and maintain a tracking system documenting events, speaking engagements, coordination activities, conference and exhibit participation opportunities, stakeholder engagement, and Silicon Valley contacts  Coordinate with the SVO Program Director to maintain and use the S&T; Customer Relations Management (CRM) system  Possesses requisite knowledge and provides customized business-focused objective advice, expertise and specialist skills to create value and improve business strategy, internal processes and program/project performance.  Supports development of business plans, policies and procedural documentation and other deliverables in support of executing decisions.  Assists with devising and implementing performance measures and related processes and systems.  Maintains responsibility for managing business solutions, delegating appropriate resources, and fostering quality assurance principles across projects and deliverables and resolving issues.  Organizes, directs and coordinates the planning and production of activities.  Oversees process and productivity improvement, systems alignment, organizational assessments, and program audits and evaluations.  Crafts and enforces quality control programs.  Requirements (education/experience/certifications) : Current TS/SCI clearance.  At least five (5) years of experience supporting conference planning, development of successful and creative communication strategies, development of marketing materials, and use of successful branding methods  At least five (5) years of experience in a business management/office management activity  Demonstrated experience working in or with a research and development organization  Demonstrated experience performing day-to-day coordination of assigned projects that involve integrated teams of professionals (such as engineers, scientists, and management)  Demonstrated experience writing high-level documents for public consumption, such as annual reports or strategy documents  Demonstrated experience developing marketing and communications content specifically for distribution at conferences and via website and social media  Awareness of DHS’s announcement of its establishment of a Silicon Valley presence  Demonstrated knowledge and experience with an organization’s internal budget development process as well as external reporting requirements  A minimum of a Bachelor of Arts (BA) or Bachelor of Science (BS) in a relevant field such as Communications, Management, or Business.  Knowledge and demonstrated experience working in a research and development organization.  Knowledge and demonstrated experience working specifically as a Science and Technical Assistance (SETA) contractor.  Awareness of the 2011 Federal Cybersecurity R&D; Strategy and the 2009 DHS S&T; Roadmap for Cybersecurity Research and how CSD research aligns with those objectives.  Awareness of Executive Order (EO) and Presidential Policy Directive (PPD) 21 and its impact on CSD research thrusts.  High proficiency with Microsoft Office suite, excellent communication and organizational skills, ability to multi-task and respond to quick turn-around requests, and willingness to assist other support contractors to complete tasks efficiently.  Demonstrated ability to proactively engage in support activity unrelated to defined job description.  Strong skills in time management and ability to work independently.  Preferences: (education/experience/certifications) : ISHPI works in concert with other defenders of the Homeland to fortify national preparedness, agility, strength and advantage in the cyber domain - a readiness state we refer to as an i-Holistic CyberStanceTM. Using our integrated i-HolisticTM service solutions fortified with CyberSmithedTM and ActiveDefenseTM processes, we weave the armor and forge the weapons that enable our clients to maintain a dominating i-Holistic CyberStanceTM - always ready to Anticipate, Defend, Exploit and Attack in the Cyber domain. Out Information Operations, Advanced Information Services, C5ISR Engineering & Technical Services, and Training & Consulting business units work in unison to provide experienced people, proven processes, technology, advice and leadership to enable full spectrum Cyber capability.  ISHPI was born a cyber-services company supporting U.S. Armed Forces personnel and other direct defenders of the homeland with a heavy focus on emerging asymmetric Information Operations. Our focus on cyber related services has held steady while our client base and functional capabilities expanded exponentially to envelop essentially all cyber impacted components of modern warfare. Philosophically, our approach to cyber surety has evolved to become Holistic in nature, based on a firm conviction that cyber activities are never truly secure unless every layer of the OSI model and every human input associated with the activity is Holistically engineered and integrated for cyber security.  In 2014 ISHPI acquired Advanced Information Services Inc., a globally recognized leader in Software Development Quality and the winner of the 2013 Government Information Security Leadership Award for secure software lifecycle practices and the IEEE Computer Society Software Process Achievement Award. The acquisition added CMMI Maturity Level 5 Cyber-Secure Software Development to ISHPI's i-Holistic CyberStanceTM Strategy.  Ishpi Information Technologies, Inc. (DBA ISHPI ) is an Equal Opportunity Employer which governs all employment related decisions without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other protected classification.  If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access www.ishpi.net/careers as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation, please contact us at www.ishpi.net  Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Females/Disabled/Veterans  VEVRAA Federal Contractor

description: Project Wing is working on self-flying vehicles that could open up entirely new approaches to delivering goods and services—including options that are cheaper, faster, less wasteful and more environmentally sensitive than what’s possible today. Project Wing is a part of X.  This role focuses on higher-level system design and architecture, including managing requirements, interfaces, and capabilities across lower-level subsystems (software modules, HW/RF transceivers, external stakeholders and data sources and databases, etc.). Responsibilities  Design high level system and subsystem architecture, including: registration and identification systems, federated “Airspace Service Provider” networks offering route deconfliction services and hosting of airspace-data (TFRs, etc.).  Manage/Track and help design interfaces between major components, including interfaces to outside stakeholders (Air Traffic Control, other data providers, etc).  Help design Minimum Operational Performance Standards (MOPS) for each subsystem/component of the airspace system.  Assist in coordinating bring-up and testing of the airspace system with the deployment of Wing unmanned delivery vehicles  Contribute to external communications, presentations, and publications of Project Wing’s airspace system design and approach/intent.  Minimum Qualifications  Experience with backend and distributed computing and networking  Experience designing systems architecture and interfaces on projects.  Experience in Safety Critical systems (e.g., design, implementation, testing, validation), including FMECA analysis and contingency management  Experience in software simulation  Preferred Qualifications  FAA certification. Experience in the development of certified systems.  Familiar with RTCA, ASTM, CMMI, and other standards/processes and documents  Software development for testing automation, data analysis, and simulation  Aviation or related field experience  Strong communication and coordination between multiple stakeholders/disciplines (including external stakeholders)  Love for airplanes  Area  X is a moonshot factory where uncomfortably ambitious, potentially world-changing new ideas such as self-driving cars, balloon-powered Internet and smart contact lenses are developed and taken out into the world. X projects have the potential to transform the lives of billions of people and make the world a radically better place. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x].

description: Summer Intern: Research Assistant/ Programmer – Location: Newark, CA Headquartered in Newark, CA, Triple Ring Technologies is an innovative technology and product development company that partners with clients to deliver complete solutions from conceptual design through product launch. Our highly interdisciplinary team includes senior professionals from industry, finance, and academia, with extensive experience in medical device, life science, clean tech, security, and industrial technologies. We both challenge and rely upon each other for technical excellence and for real-world engineering and commercial wisdom. To apply for this position, please go online to http://tripleringtech.com/AU_careers.html  What you will learn: Research and Development processes Conduct research in an industrial setting Develop a new software tool Work on a code base with multiple developers Verification and Validation of software tool Job Summary In this role you will work with the X-ray and Imaging Group and you will assist to develop and validate our new simulation platform. Our simulation platform is based on a Monte Carlo simulation package developed by CERN and is used for explosive detection using X-rays and for verifying dose in e-beam sterilization. You will help to acquire data with our in-house X-ray equipment and at an e-beam sterilization company. You will customize our tool to perform simulations reproducing experimental results. You will work closely with Triple Ring Technologies' engineers and scientists in a fast-paced, multidisciplinary and collaborative environment. You must have hands on experience in data analysis using tools such as Matlab and you must be familiar with C++. Understanding of ionizing radiation is a plus. Responsibilities Development and documentation of code Develop and execute an experimental plan Document findings Education, Experience and Skills Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Bioengineering, Physics or equivalent Experience in programming Triple Ring Technologies is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to workforce diversity. Qualified applicants will receive consideration with regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.
snippet: You will work closely with Triple Ring Technologies' engineers and scientists in a fast-paced, multidisciplinary and collaborative environment....

description: Requisition No.: 121763BR  Subsidiary: eBay Primary Job Responsibilities: Structured Data Research & Development team is tasked with taking ideas and prototypes in various machine learning disciplines and bringing them in front of users and customers. Our main focus areas are natural language processing and image classification and we are continually expanding our reach. We are looking for a technical leader who will be responsible for overseeing engineering for these efforts.  Job Requirements: Do you want to help the machines take over the world? Structured Data Research & Development team is tasked with taking ideas and prototypes in various machine learning disciplines and bringing them in front of users and customers. Our main focus areas are natural language processing and image classification and we are continually expanding our reach. We are looking for a technical leader who will be responsible for overseeing engineering for these efforts.  This leader’s responsibilities will include all aspects of the service’s experience: designing and building the software, managing its operations and guiding the team.  On the day to day you will:  Develop large-scale services that serve heavy traffic and participate in performance tuning to meet aggressive service level agreements. Develop prototypes where necessary to prove the feasibility of various technology solutions. Design, develop and test (including automated, continuous integration) key product features/components of our platform. Develop systems that are highly reliable, scalable, but surprisingly easy to maintain. Be independent in feature/component design and conduct effective peer code reviews where needed. Mentor and provide feedback. Recruit and develop great talent. Be an active participant in the architecture and design discussions. Regularly collaborate within and across teams – Applied Scientists, Ops, Platform, dependent engineer groups, QE, external partners – to propose solutions, actively participate in the integration discussions and triage platform issues. Continuously innovate through frequent product iterations (Agile/Scrum setup). Participate in the developer community (internal and open source) to learn, share and grow to be an excellent technical expert and actively grow your career based on your career aspirations.  You should be good at:  Problem solving and have past demonstration of coming up with creative solutions to tough challenges Developing highly reliable, scalable real-time services, including sound knowledge of designing RESTful services Continuous Integration, Maven, GitHub and Agile/Scrum setup is preferred Java with good object-oriented methodology, frameworks and development of complex modules Communication and collaboration skills to participate & shape the architecture, high level and detailed designs of the systems Design, development and testing of large and complex applications  It is great if you know:  Hadoop Map/Reduce, Big Data Machine Learning, Deep Learning NLP tools such as POS tagging, NER, stemming, parsing, WSD, sentence segmentation is highly preferred Machine Learning tools such as Mahout, sci-kit Learn, Caffe, SparkML, CUDA etc. Bachelor’s Degree, Masters preferred  Evil lair not included. Last Updated: 03/15/2016

description: PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:  Under the guidance of a PhD scientist the candidate will assist in the development of chromatography-based methodologies for purification and QC assays. The highly independent individual will be responsible for collection and analysis of data with complete documentation of experiments. General lab maintenance and ordering lab supplies will also be required.  Requirements REQUIREMENTS & EXPERIENCE:  2+ in biotechnology or pharmaceutical industry BS/MS in biochemistry, chemistry, biology, bioengineering or equivalent   DESIRED EXPERIENCE:  Experience in viral purification using chromatography methodologies  Molecular biology techniques (PCR, cloning/sub-cloning, DNA purification and analysis)  Real Time qPCR  Protein gels and Western blotting  Working with RNA (in vitro transcription, RNA purification and biophysical characterization)  ELISA assays   CANDIDATE SHOULD ALSO BE:   Able to work independently   Comfortable working in a small team environment   Detail oriented and have excellent organizational and time management skills
snippet: The highly independent individual will be responsible for collection and analysis of data with complete documentation of experiments....

description: Contribute to multiple projects relating to all aspects of assay development: from conceptual design, proof-of-concept, demonstration of clinical correlations, to validation. Work with other research associates and scientists within the team to design and execute experiments for advanced cellular analysis, using traditional as well as novel methods. Analyze data and communicate results in an intense, inter-disciplinary environment. Demonstrate a keen interest in learning new skills and growing the scope of their scientific and technical expertise. Use multiple laboratory techniques such as DNA/RNA purification, microscopy, protein conjugation and purification, cell culture, and UV-Vis, etc. The individual will also quickly develop familiarity with other techniques. Rapidly become part of a close-knit and highly-driven team of scientists and research associates. REQUIREMENTS Master's degree in Biological sciences: molecular and cell biology, immunology, or Physical Biosciences: bio/chemical-engineering, biophysics, or related field from a top tier scientific university and superior academic credentials. 1-2 years of experience or B.S. with 2-4 years of experience. Recent graduates with experience in academic labs are also encouraged to apply. Unfaltering determination to excel in an intense start-up environment. Excellent academic record; a driven individual who has a strong desire to learn. Demonstrably rigorous experimentalist with attention to detail and a creative problem solver. Extensive experience with most of the following laboratory techniques: biochemical signaling assays, cell-based assays, microscopy, bioconjugations using off-the-shelf kits, UV-Vis, and cell culture. Ability to effectively handle multiple projects at the same time and work in a highly interdisciplinary team. Ability to support research and development work as an associate in industrial, corporate setting.
snippet: Rapidly become part of a close-knit and highly-driven team of scientists and research associates. Work with other research associates and scientists within the...

description: Do you spend your time thinking about simple, elegant code? Are you a highly skilled software engineer who wants to build useful tools, web services, and APIs? Do you long for a chance to make it easier to consume, process, and understand data? Are you an expert in python, but often feel like dabbling in new languages when it makes sense?   We are seeking a talented software engineer to work on the tools and microservices that make up our big data platform. Netflix is ingesting hundreds of terabytes of data a day and has petabytes of data in the data warehouse. We work hard to build a platform that allows our data scientists to deal with this data at scale. But that isn't the only way that we need to interact with the data. This is where you come in. Whether it is building tools to allow for better exploration and visualization of the data, creating services to help coordinate work on the platform, or dreaming up new ways to write software that is simple yet powerful, we have a lot of hard, exciting problems to solve and many smart people to work with while we make Netflix the best place to enjoy movies and TV worldwide.   This is your dream job if you:   Value simplicity and clarity in design. Our engineering strongly reflects this value Want to build a platform to solve interesting data problems Pride yourself on being an expert software engineer Love to build software in the cloud Desire to be constantly learning new things and can make good forward thinking judgments about new technology Have a BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science or related field   Technologies we use:   Python, plus other languages where it makes sense Pandas, numpy, scipy, cherrypy among other useful python libraries Git for source control The right technologies for the problem at hand. We're flexible and open to rapid change
jobtitle: Senior Software Engineer - Big Data Cloud Infrastructure

description: Job Description: Performs a wide range of medical laboratory tests used to diagnose, treat and prevent disease. Using technical knowledge and a theoretical understanding of the basis of the tests, records and validates the accuracy and quality of results to ensure conformity to specifications. Understands and applies the correct control measures and protocols in cases of abnormal results, reporting any discrepancies to a Senior, Reference, or Supervising Clinical Laboratory Scientist. Calibrates assays where the calibration is part of each run. Maintains supply inventory, performs and documents routine preventative maintenance and records is performance. Performs simple troubleshooting and reports instrument malfunctions to senior staff. Has an understanding and maintains current knowledge of specialty area(s) assigned in the laboratory.  Accurately performs and completes laboratory analysis on body fluids in accordance with laboratory protocols and policies. Adheres to all safety/health and state/federal regulatory requirements and the procedures, policies and Services Standard defined by the Hospitals. Applies the appropriate control measures in test with abnormal results. Handles results in accordance with protocol and notifies the necessary personnel. Demonstrates technical proficiency in all areas of assigned responsibility. Keeps abreast of new technical developments and acquires the necessary skills to adapt to technological changes. Maintains a current understanding of all procedures used in the assigned laboratory section(s) and can interpret the significance of normal and abnormal results. Performs clinical laboratory tests of varying complexity using standard procedures examining specimens for the purpose of providing information for the diagnosis, prevention, or treatment of disease. Performs maintenance and function checks on analytical equipment and perform operational checks necessary for proper test performance to assure accurate and reliable test results and reporting. Performs other duties as assigned by supervisors. Resolves problems related to clinical issues, equipment or testing by initiating research utilizing available reference material. Reports and/or escalates problems to management as appropriate. Using technical knowledge and theoretical understanding of the basis of tests, records and analyzes test results to validate accuracy, quality and conformity to specifications. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status or on the basis of disability.  Qualificiations: Minimum Qualifications: Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills and abilities as well as possession of any required licenses or certifications is qualifying.  Education: Bachelor's degree in a work-related discipline/field from an accredited college or university  Experience: One (1) year of progressively responsible and directly related work experience  License/Certification: Clinical Laboratory Scientist (CLS)  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities These are the observable and measurable attributes and skills required to perform successfully the essential functions of the job and are generally demonstrated through qualifying experience, education, or licensure/certification. Ability to analyze data, draw conclusions and interpret results Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing Ability to learn new procedures and adapt to technological changes in the laboratory Ability to organize, prioritize, multi-task, and adapt to changing priorities Ability to solve problems and identify solutions Ability to work effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization Knowledge and technical proficiency in specialty areas assigned within the laboratory Knowledge of infection prevention policies and procedures Knowledge of local, state and federal regulatory requirements related to areas of functional responsibility

description: Merck & Co., Inc. Kenilworth, N.J., U.S.A. known as Merck in the United States and Canada, is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company – one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us.  Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of an individual like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.  Scientist, Protein Analytical Characterization  We are looking for an experienced protein analytical biochemist to carry out extensive analytical characterization of recombinant proteins and monoclonal antibodies to support Biologics Discovery research at Merck Palo Alto.  Candidates must have deep and broad knowledge of protein analytical technology including chromatographic and biophysical characterization methods such as HPLC (SEC, IEX, RP), capillary electrophoresis, cIEF, DLS, SEC-MALS, DSC/DSF,..  Duties and responsibilites may include, but are not limited to:  Ability to analyze, interpret and effectively present data at group and departmental meetings is required.  Ability to write internal reports and give presentations on technical and scientific findings is required.  The candidate will must have very strong attention to details and ability to maintain accurate records.  Experience with high-throughput analytical characterization methods and automation is preferred.  Experience with protein and antibody purification is preferred.  Experience in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry is preferred  Qualifications  Education: Required: BS  Preferred: MS  Required: Solid and proven theoretical basis and hands-on experience in protein purification and analytical characterization  Ability to analyze, interpret and effectively present data at group and departmental meetings is required.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential  Strong organizational skills  Preferred: Experience with high-throughput analytical characterization methods and automation  Experience in the pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry  Our employees are the key to our company’s success. We demonstrate our commitment to our employees by offering a competitive and valuable rewards program. Our Company’s benefits are designed to support the wide range of goals, needs and lifestyles of our employees, and many of the people that matter the most in their lives. If you need an accommodation for the application process please email us at staffingaadar@merck.com.  Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully: Merck & Co., Inc. is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Merck via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Merck. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Merck as a result of the referral or through other means.  Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.  For more information about personal rights under Equal Employment Opportunity, visit:  EEOC Poster  EEOC GINA Supplement?  Merck is an equal opportunity employer, Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran – proudly embracing diversity in all of its manifestations. description: Google is known for our innovative technologies, products and services — and for the people behind them. The Google People Services (GPS) team focuses on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers. As a Staffing Services Associate, you will enthusiastically represent the Google brand and build our talent pipeline. Whether it’s making our staffing systems more efficient, planning for our growth, building relationships on college campuses or cultivating the next generation of computer scientists, you will have an eye on the staffing needs of Google and the broader hiring landscape. You'll be focused on cultivating outstanding candidates for Google's long-term hiring needs, and you are the glue that ties together a cross-functional and international group of staffing teams.  As a Staffing Services Associate you'll ensure a seamless, candidate-friendly hiring process. You'll be responsible for keeping the process organized and efficient while actively maintaining clear lines of communication with recruiters, hiring managers and candidates - from entry-level to senior leadership hires. By providing great customer service and smoothly managing all the details, you'll contribute to the overall success of the Staffing team. You are both scrappy and resourceful, creative and driven -- and excited to share the magic of working at Google.  Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field. Responsibilities Due to business needs, we are prioritizing candidates that are available to start before May.  Minimum Qualifications  Support client groups with recruiting processes including scheduling interviews, organizing candidate travel arrangements, hosting candidates on campus, reserving conference rooms and liaising with candidates, leaders at Google and their administrative partners, as appropriate.  Create and distribute employment-related correspondence.  Communicate professionally, tactfully and with the utmost diplomacy at all times, treating all candidates with dignity and respect and maintaining a high level of confidentiality at all times.  Arrange special requests and provide a high-touch experience appropriate to the candidate’s needs.  Improve processes using a data-drive approach including optimization of interviewer loads, identification of trends and issues in the scheduling process, and execution of initiatives to increase efficiency and improve experience.  Preferred Qualifications  BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.  Area  Experience in improving processes, identifying issues in processes, suggesting user focused improvements and navigating/influencing cross-functional teams to drive these changes.  High level of creativity, perseverance, and openness to change with a drive to take initiative and build strong, productive relationships.  Self-directed, detail-oriented problem solver with a burning desire to contribute to the organization's reputation and success.  Exceptional attention to detail with a proven ability to consistently and positively contribute in a fast-paced, changing work environment with the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks and manage time efficiently.  Demonstrated discretion and strong judgment, with the ability to interact comfortably and professionally with all levels of candidates and internal clients. Strong demonstrated interpersonal and communication skills, a customer-service orientation, and a welcoming, helpful attitude.

description: Position Summary  This position will focus on analytical characterization activities in support of therapeutic protein development. Responsibilities will include development of new product specific assays as well as routine testing of in-process samples. Will work independently and serve as subject matter expert for their focus area, including leading method development, qualification, and technology transfer activities. The position will also perform routine testing and general support activities as needed to meet the goals of Revance Therapeutics’ development programs.   Essential Duties  • Regularly apply basic theory and principles from one’s technical expertise to develop, optimize, and transfer analytical assays for product characterization, lot release, and stability testing.  • Coordinate and conduct routine testing support for other groups within Revance Development and Manufacturing Functions.  • Perform routine instrument/equipment maintenance and calibration checks to ensure the proper function and compliant use.  • Provide regular progress updates to manager and present data to internal and external audiences in a succinct and well organized manner.  • Author test methods and development reports.  • Serve as subject matter expert for at least one technical area and train other laboratory personnel on the use and maintenance of equipment.  • Lead technical transfer of assays to and from contract test laboratories or to QC.  • Plan experiments with limited manager oversight and work independently to achieve deliverables with minimal instruction.  • Develop and implement laboratory policies for critical reagents, data management, organizational performance, and continuous improvement.  • Maintain laboratory notebooks and forms consistent with Good Documentation Practices.  • Maintain adequate supplies of laboratory reagents and coordinate biohazard and chemical waste disposal.   Requirements Qualifications  • Solid training in general laboratory practices (e.g., buffer preparation, sample dilution, micro-pipetting).  • Experience in the development and optimization of assays for pharmaceutical characterization.  • Experience in one or more of the following areas, including training and troubleshooting experience:  Chromatography or capillary electrophoresis  Mass spectrometry  Immunochemical assays  Spectroscopy  Cell based assays  • Working knowledge of cGMP practices and ICH guidelines.  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required.  • Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to efficiently function in a team-oriented environment.  • Excellent planning and organizational skills with good documentation, record management habits, and attention to detail.  • Ability to handle multiple projects and to demonstrate initiative and take accountability.  • Flexible and adaptable to meet the needs of the organization.   Preferred Education  • Chemistry or Biological Science degree: bachelors with 8+ years, masters with 6+ years, or doctorate with 2+ years of experience in biopharmaceutical analytical development.  • This is a senior technical position; level is dependent on experience and qualifications.   Preferred Additional Skills (i.e., Computer)  • Proficient with Microsoft-based applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
snippet: Will work independently and serve as subject matter expert for their focus area, including leading method development, qualification, and technology transfer...

description: Position Summary  @WalmartLabs brings together dozens of engineers, scientists and product experts to execute a cutting edge vision. If you're fluent in the language of innovation, @WalmartLabs is a place to become a leading change agent. Join us! Position Description  As a Sr Software Engineer for Wal-Mart’s Global eCommerce division, you will have the opportunity to help define and implement components for Wal-Mart’s next-generation, global eCommerce platform. This hands-on position, reporting to the Engineering Manager at Walmart, will be part of the engineering team, working on all the aspects of the design and implementation of Information Services. The key areas of work involve building a massively scalable and high performance enterprise data service solutions using MPP data warehouse and Hadoop, build & maintain finance & marketing applications, business intelligence reports and analytics. A wide degree of creativity and efficiency is a plus. As a self-motivated and enthusiastic member of our team, you will be working closely with the product and senior management, other development teams, DBA's, operations, release and scheduling teams, and quality assurance teams. You will be responsible for the end to end delivery of the product, enhancements to existing processes and day to day support. You will also play a critical role in designing, developing and providing technical guidance to engineers and ensuring project delivery and quality. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field and 5 years of experience building scalable ecommerce applications or mobile software.  3+ years of experience with building scalable, high performing and robust Java applications  Experience with big data methodologies involving Hive/Hadoop/ Spark;  Experience with Hadoop workflow management using Azkaban, Oozie, Hamake or Cascading  Hadoop stream processing using Storm  Experience with no-sql technologies like Cassandra, couchbase, Flume or Hbase.  Advanced scripting skills in at least one of the following: Python, Perl or Shell and willingness to learn new technologies  Experience with Eclipse or other IDE development tools  Experience with Continuous Integration and related tools (i.e. Jenkins, Hudson, Maven)  Experience with Code Quality Governance related tools (Sonar, Gerrit, PMD, FindBugs, Checkstyle, Emma, Cobertura, JIRA, etc)  Experience with Source Code Management Tools (GitHUB, SVN, CVS, Clearcase)  Additional Preferred Qualifications  Masters Degree in Computer Science or related field  2 years experience developing using J2EE technologies such as Servlet/JSP/Filters, JNDI, JDBC, JMS, JMX, RMI, Java Web Services, etc.  2 years experience with Eclipse or other IDE development tools  1 year experience developing with web/app containers such as Web Logic, Web Sphere, Apache/Tomcat, Jboss etc.  2 years experience developing using relational databases such as Oracle or MySQL  Req ID: 634623BR

description: Position Objective   The Thermo Scientific Quality Controls team is a group of passionate individuals dedicated to changing the way medicine is practiced. We are building a talented team of scientists and engineers dedicated to the Quality Controls business (MAS and AcroMetrix brands), based in our Fremont site in the San Francisco Bay area. This is an opportunity for a highly motivated software engineer to work in a fast-paced environment and develop diagnostic tools at the cutting edge of technology and medicine.   As part of the Thermo Fisher Diagnostic Quality Controls Business, the Engineer III will lead R&D; software activities aimed at designing and developing products that include web and PC-based software tools that support molecular diagnostic quality control in a clinical setting. The Engineer III will design, develop, and validate software on various development platforms. Activities will include creating software requirements/specifications, development, and validation. The ideal candidate will be a team player who is passionate about delivering simple, effective, customer-focused products. This position will also function in partnership with renowned investigators at research institutions, industry, and clinical laboratories worldwide. This is a great opportunity to work with biochemists, chemists, non-R&D; functions, customers and vendors to create products to enable our customers to deliver high quality diagnostics.   Essential Functions   Develop web-based and desktop applications using the .NET framework (C#). Plan front and back-end schematics with UML modeling and user interface mockups. Establish, write, and validate product specifications and testing procedures related to the development of new software tools for molecular diagnostics. Communicate with customers for collaboration and feedback. Represent R&D; on project teams aimed at launching new software products. Communicate progress and results to team members in a clear and organized manner. Develop software based on relational databases (SQL Server or MySQL). Troubleshoot software-related performance issues. Work within the ISO 13485 and FDA QSR compliant Quality System. Maintain up to date and organized development notes. Quality of documentation must be sufficient to support patent claims. Perform other related duties and responsibilities as required and/or assigned.  Education:   Requires a Masters degree in computer science or related field plus at least 5 years of relevant experience.   Experience/Requirements:   The successful candidate will: Have excellent communication skills. Expertise with .NET framework (C#) for web-based and desktop applications is required. description: Sr. Scientist, Pharmacokinetics-PHA001295   Description   Merck & Co., Inc. Kenilworth, N.J., U.S.A. known as Merck in the United States and Canada, is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company – one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us.   Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of an individual like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.   The Biologics Discovery, DMPK and Disposition function at MRL, Palo Alto focuses strongly on the application of computational biology, systems pharmacology and quantitative principles during the discovery and early development for biologics in an integrated fashion   The position will be a critical member of the function providing strong expertise necessary for development of:   - Drug and combination therapeutic concepts and dose predictions for the design and conduct of preclinical efficacy and nonclinical safety studies  - Application of computational biology and systems pharmacology principles in order to establish and build predictive preclinical drug combination frameworks with application in various therapeutic areas  - Mechanistic approaches (and in an integrated fashion) for integration of key properties such as-- target expression, gene profiles, signaling and pathways, construct properties, disease considerations-- for establishing exposure-response relationships in relevant preclinical studies and assisting in projection of doses in early human clinical studies in support of IND submissions.  - Network analysis and application of bioinformatics principles in data mining and evaluation/interpretation of complex biological systems  - To lead the central core modeling and quantitative function for the department  - To represent the function at the project teams, and collaborate directly and closely with other members of the team and Merck.   Qualifications   Our employees are the key to our company’s success. We demonstrate our commitment to our employees by offering a competitive and valuable rewards program. Our Company’s benefits are designed to support the wide range of goals, needs and lifestyles of our employees, and many of the people that matter the most in their lives. If you need an accommodation for the application process please email us at staffingaadar@merck.com.   Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully:   Merck & Co., Inc. is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Merck via email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Merck. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Merck as a result of the referral or through other means.   Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.   For more information about personal rights under Equal Employment Opportunity, visit:   EEOC Poster   EEOC GINA Supplement?   Merck is an equal opportunity employer, Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran – proudly embracing diversity in all of its manifestations. description: Summer Intern: Research Assistant/ Programmer – Location: Newark, CA Headquartered in Newark, CA, Triple Ring Technologies is an innovative technology and product development company that partners with clients to deliver complete solutions from conceptual design through product launch. Our highly interdisciplinary team includes senior professionals from industry, finance, and academia, with extensive experience in medical device, life science, clean tech, security, and industrial technologies. We both challenge and rely upon each other for technical excellence and for real-world engineering and commercial wisdom. To apply for this position, please go online to http://tripleringtech.com/AU_careers.html  What you will learn: Research and Development processes Conduct research in an industrial setting Develop a new software tool Work on a code base with multiple developers Verification and Validation of software tool Job Summary In this role you will work with the X-ray and Imaging Group and you will assist to develop and validate our new simulation platform. Our simulation platform is based on a Monte Carlo simulation package developed by CERN and is used for explosive detection using X-rays and for verifying dose in e-beam sterilization. You will help to acquire data with our in-house X-ray equipment and at an e-beam sterilization company. You will customize our tool to perform simulations reproducing experimental results. You will work closely with Triple Ring Technologies' engineers and scientists in a fast-paced, multidisciplinary and collaborative environment. You must have hands on experience in data analysis using tools such as Matlab and you must be familiar with C++. Understanding of ionizing radiation is a plus. Responsibilities Development and documentation of code Develop and execute an experimental plan Document findings Education, Experience and Skills Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Bioengineering, Physics or equivalent Experience in programming Triple Ring Technologies is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to workforce diversity. Qualified applicants will receive consideration with regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.

description: About Us VMware NSX is a network virtualization platform that delivers the operational model of a virtual machine for the network. Virtual networks reproduce the network model in software, allowing complex multi-tier network topologies to be created and provisioned programmatically in seconds. NSX includes a library of logical networking services – logical switches, logical routers, logical firewalls, logical load balancers, logical VPN, QoS, and distributed security.  A self-service interface allows users to create custom combinations of these services in isolated software-based virtual networks that support existing applications without modification or deliver unique requirements for new application workloads. Similar to virtual machines in compute, virtual networks are programmatically provisioned and managed independent of networking hardware. Decoupling from hardware introduces agility, speed and operational efficiency that has transformed data center economics.  Why work for our Division VMware’s world-class, award-winning R&D; team is comprised of thousands of top-notch computer scientists and software engineers that are transforming computing through virtualization. Members of the R&D; team voice their creative ideas and watch them become initiatives, participate in exciting short-term and long-term products on the VMware roadmap, initiate advanced research projects, and/or write and test code that ships. At VMware, our engineers continue to learn and grow by working with top professionals from around the world and recent graduates of top universities and by taking advantage of our extensive internal training opportunities and generous external education assistance program. R&D; team members work on the latest computing equipment and have access to the ACM and IEEE libraries. VMware has R&D; offices in: Silicon Valley; Burlington, MA; Cambridge, MA; Broomfield, CO; Sofia, Bulgaria; Aarhus, Denmark; London, UK; Herzliya, Israel; Bangalore, India; and Beijing, China.  Job Description: VMware is looking for a Senior Manager of Engineering who is interested in joining our NSX performance team that is responsible for performance of all NSX products, solutions and emerging new technologies. You will manage the team that is defining performance methodology, characterizing performance, developing solutions for better performance, developing performance monitoring tools, developing new benchmarks and driving the product architecture for high performance and scale. Team is also responsible for building a flexible and scalable infrastructure for performance monitoring, analysis, tracking and reporting. You will manage a high performing core engineering team that is deeply technical, dynamic, agile, dedicated and innovative. You will be driving projects across many cross functional teams and having an impact on large number of products and people. You will be defining new processes to ensure that performance remains fundamental as NSX develops and expands to new markets. You will participate in many innovative projects, with the authority and scope to apply your expertise in technically driven environment. You¹ll be part of a bright engineering team that has an open communication,empowerment, innovation, teamwork and customer success culture. You will have an opportunity to build and grow a team in a fast paced environment.  Responsibilities: Set performance goals in close collaboration with development and product management teams. Drive a project across multiple cross-functional teams to ensure the desired performance is achieved. Set a high bar for performance and work with all stakeholders to maintain that. Drive the long term direction of the product for higher performance and scale. Strong ability to influence others and build consensus using good written and verbal communication skills and customer facing skills Ensure team is aligned to a common goal. Communicate with all stakeholders and team members and provide updates. Perform other duties and responsibilities as requested or required.  Requirements: A Computer Science or related master¹s degree 8+ Years of industry experience Strong leadership skills Capable of architecting/understanding complex software solutions Strong Communication skills Developing visioning skills and ability to see the big picture Passion to mentor and build a high performance team  Desired Skills: Experience working in large-scale systems Experience with performance benchmarks and methodology Excellent verbal communication, analytical skill and critical thinking. Strong background in networking and systems.  joinNSX growNSX 71573BR 71573

description: DuPont Industrial Biosciences is seeking a Process Technician to join our Palo Alto, California R&D; analytical team. In this role, your primary responsibility will be to provide assay support to our fermentation, recovery, and formulation groups through the use of primarily colorimetric assays.   Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  Operate and maintain automated enzymatic assay equipment, and other analytical instruments as needed  Support assay development and assay transfer to and from our global R&D; and manufacturing sites  Data analysis and interpretation; Communicate results to scientists and collaborators  Participate in continuous team efforts to improve process analytical capabilities, team efficiency and data quality   Job Qualifications The following are required:  Associate's degree in Physical/Biological Sciences  Basic understanding of assay principles such as use of standard curves and assay controls  High attention to detail and ability to work in a team environment  Experience with using word processing and data analysis software (MS Word and Excel), and computer-based systems for operating instruments  The following are preferred:  BS Degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry or Biology  A basic understanding of QC/QA operations  Experience in buffer and reagent preparation  Experience with using analytical pipettes and analytical balances for  volumetric and gravimetric dilutions  Familiarity with UV-vis spectrometers, HPLCs and other analytical instruments  In addition, the successful candidate must:  Demonstrate an ability to consistently generate and deliver high quality analytical data  Possess good record-keeping skills and excellent attention to detail  Possess basic troubleshooting and problem-solving skills  Demonstrate strong verbal and written communication skills  Demonstrate an ability to multi-task in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment  Demonstrate an ability to work effectively in both individual and team settings  Possess a strong desire to learn and excel  DuPont Industrial Biosciences comprises an unmatched portfolio of capabilities in industrial biotechnology and biobased solutions. The unique combination of agricultural, biotechnology, chemical and material science capabilities allows DuPont Industrial Biosciences to deliver cost-effective products with superior performance and sustainability aspects to a range of industries. Bringing together the expertise from Danisco, Genencor, and DuPont has yielded a unique combination of strengths in enzyme technology, materials science, and bioprocessing. We call it Powered by DuPont™ Genencor® Science. It’s what powers the innovations to help solve some of the world’s greatest challenges.

description: A9.com, an Amazon company, creates powerful, customer-focused search and advertising solutions and technologies . Whenever a customer visits an Amazon site worldwide and types in a query or browses through product categories, A9 Product Search services go to work. We design, develop, and deploy high performance, fault-tolerant distributed search systems used by millions of Amazon customers every day. Our Search Relevance team works to maximize the quality and effectiveness of the search experience for visitors to Amazon websites worldwide.  Amazon Video and Amazon Music have many millions of users daily. Movies and Music are critical strategic categories for Amazon with fast growth. The Digital Search Relevance team is a small, highly talented, engineering team focused on solving highly impactful relevance problems within this strategic category. In this role you’ll be a technical leader within the Search Relevance organization, which includes several engineering areas for improving search quality and effectiveness. You will own the full development cycle - from inception to deploying in production systems. Projects will span the whole development pipeline, including data analysis, prototyping, machine learning (ML), natural language processing (NLP), A/B testing, and creating production code that runs at massive scale. The role interacts with many teams team to create solutions - Analytics, Infrastructure, Operations Engineering, etc. In this highly visible position you will work alongside some of the internet’s most influential visionaries with ownership of one of the highest growth categories for Amazon.  At A9, you’ll experience the benefits of working in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment, while leveraging the resources of Amazon.com (AMZN), one of the world's leading internet companies. We provide a highly customer-centric, team-oriented environment in our offices located in Palo Alto, California.  As the leader for Digital Search Relevance you will: Drive Search Relevance, Ranking, and Query Understanding Amazon Movies and Music categories. Identify customer pain points, understand business challenges, and solve technical problems to address them. Develop ML and NLP models to improve relevance across all access points – mobile, desktop, and voice. Define project deliverables with long term customer satisfaction as the target. Collaborate with teams across A9.com, and Amazon, to improve the Search experience across a variety of devices. Lead the design and implementation of technical solutions requiring a strong background in algorithms, analytics, data mining, machine learning, A/B testing, and customer facing code that runs at scale. Recruit, hire and cultivate great engineering talent to attack challenging technical situations. Basic Qualifications:  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related engineering discipline. A minimum of 5 years of experience leading software development teams. At Least 2 years of domain experience in Search, Information Retrieval, or Relevance. At least 2 years of experience in Machine Learning (ML) and/or Natural Language Processing (NLP). Preferred Qualifications:  Ability to recruit, and develop, a high-performing engineering team of computer science engineers and data scientists. In-depth knowledge of a variety of applied machine learning methods and techniques. Proven track record in shipping products/services with high quality standards. Strong understanding of data structures and algorithms. Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical partners. Ability to effectively work, and communicate, with Senior Executives. Ability to work independently with little direct supervision. Ability to function well in loosely structured situations involving uncertainties and a range of opinions. Bias for action, with strong customer focus. Excellent decision maker who drives action, high quality, and results. Job # 15173

description: Inscopix stands at the forefront of Next Generation Neuroscience. Our flagship product for imaging large-scale neural circuit activity during behavior, nVista, provides neuroscientists with the ability to generate unprecedented data sets. The product was selected by The Scientist as the #1 Innovation of 2013 and has been covered in top scientific journals and media outlets. Since launching our Neuroscience Early Access Program in October 2012, we have built a significant customer base comprised of nearly 100 prestigious neuroscience laboratories (including 6 Nobel Laureate labs) and major pharmaceutical companies.   We are seeking an experienced Director/Head of Sales to lead our global sales efforts, with an initial focus on developing the North American market. The position will provide the opportunity for an experienced sales professional to take on a leadership role at a company that stands to make a major impact on the field of neuroscience. You will lead a well-organized sales process and be responsible for selling nVista Starter Packages (a comprehensive end-to-end solution including the nVista product, Mosaic software, support and training, and consumables) to neuroscience research labs at Universities and Institutes across the world. You will also be responsible for implementing strategies for repeat sales and for driving Account Sales (e.g., through sales of consumables and Care packages). You must have a proven track record of closing sales opportunities for sophisticated instrumentation and solutions in the life science research industry.   Responsibilities:  Hit sales targets for nVista Starter Packages in the US, Canada, and select international markets. Develop a well-organized sales process that together with Marketing proactively generates new leads, qualifies leads according to scientific fit, and nurtures leads through to opportunity conversion. . Actively pursue sales prospects through sales presentations and leveraging Application Scientists as required. Implement strategies for repeat sales and drive sales of consumables and Inscopix Care packages. Build and lead a lean salesforce to scale-up sales efforts. Use data-driven analytics to optimize sales cycle and other key sales performance metrics. Manage, report, and forecast on region-based sales of nVista Starter Packages. Represent Inscopix at major scientific meetings and conferences. Minimum Requirements:  Bachelor’s Degree in Biology or related scientific discipline (Neuroscience background is preferred). 10+ years of experience in life sciences research industry. Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets. Demonstrated success managing and leading Sales Representatives. Experience with CRM databases such as Salesforce. Excellent communication skills with the ability to work directly with all levels of the organization as well as with customers (especially with Principal Investigators). Willingness to travel (20-40%) for customer visits and conferences. How to Apply:   Please forward cover letter and resume   About Inscopix:   Inscopix is pioneering a new paradigm in the quest to understand the brain and its diseases. Combining revolutionary technology and methods for imaging of large-scale neural activity in a naturally behaving subject, Inscopix has developed the means to relate causal neural circuit dynamics to corresponding behavior. With its flagship product, nVista HD, Inscopix is today disseminating these capabilities to neuroscientists across the world, empowering them to gather unprecedented data sets and make breakthrough scientific discoveries. With in-house neuroscience expertise combined with strategic collaborations around the world, Inscopix stands at the brink of making fundamental advances in basic brain research and treatments for diseases such as Parkinson’s, autism, and schizophrenia.

description: Position: Software Engineer   Location: Santa Clara, CA 95054 Start: ASAP Duration: Full-time/Direct Hire   Status: U.S. citizens/Green card ONLY due to government or federal requirement   Must be able to pass a background check and drug screen   What we’re looking for:   Tired of building variants of the same application over and over? What we value:   * BS (MS Preferred) in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent  * Must have 10+ years of experience as a software developer with demonstrated success in a fast paced development environment  * Must have working knowledge of front end technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript  * Experience with modern web frameworks - React, Angular, Backbone, RoR, Bootstrap, UIKit, Foundation  * Must have strong proficiency in one or more programming language such as Java, Go, Ruby and be ready to discuss applications you have built using them  * Experience with test driven development (TDD) and test frameworks - JUnit, Selenium, Mocha.js, Jest, Ginkgo  * Must have solid algorithm development and analysis skills in OOD/OOP paradigms  * Experience using SQL and RDMS (PostgreSQL preferred)  * Experience with development on Linux or another Unix variant.

description: VMware NSX is a network virtualization platform that delivers the operational model of a virtual machine for the network. Virtual networks reproduce the network model in software, allowing complex multi-tier network topologies to be created and provisioned programmatically in seconds. NSX includes a library of logical networking services – logical switches, logical routers, logical firewalls, logical load balancers, logical VPN, QoS, and distributed security.  A self-service interface allows users to create custom combinations of these services in isolated software-based virtual networks that support existing applications without modification or deliver unique requirements for new application workloads. Similar to virtual machines in compute, virtual networks are programmatically provisioned and managed independent of networking hardware. Decoupling from hardware introduces agility, speed and operational efficiency that has transformed data center economics.  Why work for our Division VMware’s world-class, award-winning R&D; team is comprised of thousands of top-notch computer scientists and software engineers that are transforming computing through virtualization. Members of the R&D; team voice their creative ideas and watch them become initiatives, participate in exciting short-term and long-term products on the VMware roadmap, initiate advanced research projects, and/or write and test code that ships. At VMware, our engineers continue to learn and grow by working with top professionals from around the world and recent graduates of top universities and by taking advantage of our extensive internal training opportunities and generous external education assistance program. R&D; team members work on the latest computing equipment and have access to the ACM and IEEE libraries. VMware has R&D; offices in: Silicon Valley; Burlington, MA; Cambridge, MA; Broomfield, CO; Sofia, Bulgaria; Aarhus, Denmark; London, UK; Herzliya, Israel; Bangalore, India; and Beijing, China.  Why work with our Group Engineers interested in systems architecture, systems software, and distributed systems get to design and implement novel operating system techniques and algorithms for managing both virtual and real computer hardware. They work on harnessing the power of highly sophisticated computer and storage hardware.  Job Description  Opportunity Snapshot: VMware is looking for a Staff Engineer who is interested in joining our Software Defined Datacenter team.  Responsibilities: As a hands-on developer, be capable of fully understanding the networking system and implementing and guiding the changes required to maximize virtual and physical I/O performance and scalability.  Work on networking resource management requirements for virtual networks and virtual machines; work on kernel and user space software; problem analysis, resolution, and debugging.  Requirements: Extensive experience in C/C++/Java coding on Linux or Windows, algorithms and data structures. Solid knowledge of modern UNIX kernels (i.e., Linux, BSD, Solaris, AIX, or HP/UX) in kernel/C development, debugging, problem and performance analysis. Knowledge of CPU internals, CPU schedulers, memory management  Good Understanding of layer-2, and/or layer-3 network protocols and technologies.  Good knowledge of Packet Forwarding Data Path in Routers and Switches.  Strong familiarity with TCP/IP protocol suites  Have dealt with ARP, ND6, DHCP etc IP/IPv6 Forwarding Plane experience, GRE Tunneling, PBR etc  Desired Skills: X86 platform CPU and server architecture  CPU scheduling and memory management, networking file system, SMP locking, interrupt routing  Distributed systems knowledge  Education: A Computer Science undergraduate and/or master’s degree or PhD in Computer Science is required.  EEO Statement VMware is an equal opportunity employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Equal opportunity and consideration are afforded to all qualified applicants and employees in personnel actions, which include: recruiting and hiring, selection for training, promotion, rates of pay or other compensation, transfer, discipline, demotion, layoff or termination. VMware does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, gender identity, gender expression, family medical history or genetic information, citizenship, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, veteran status, military status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. VMware also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law. Further, it is the policy of VMware to maintain a working environment free of all forms of harassment.  joinNSX growNSX 71974BR 71974

description: Job Description: Supervise the work of laboratory personnel engaged in performing routine and specialized technical procedures, including planning laboratory work, evaluating work performed and handling procedural and technical laboratory problems.  Essential Functions  The essential functions listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classification. They are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned. Employees must abide by all Joint Commission Requirements including but not limited to sensitivity to cultural diversity, patient care, patient's rights and ethical treatment, safety and security of physical environments, emergency management, teamwork, respect for others, participation in ongoing education and training, communication and adherence to safety and quality programs, sustaining compliance with National Patient Safety Goals, and licensure and health screenings. Supervises laboratory personnel engaged in performing routine and specialized technical procedures. description: Position Summary  This position will focus on analytical characterization activities in support of therapeutic protein development. Responsibilities will include development of new product specific assays as well as routine testing of in-process samples. Will work independently and serve as subject matter expert for their focus area, including leading method development, qualification, and technology transfer activities. The position will also perform routine testing and general support activities as needed to meet the goals of Revance Therapeutics’ development programs.   Essential Duties  • Regularly apply basic theory and principles from one’s technical expertise to develop, optimize, and transfer analytical assays for product characterization, lot release, and stability testing.  • Coordinate and conduct routine testing support for other groups within Revance Development and Manufacturing Functions.  • Perform routine instrument/equipment maintenance and calibration checks to ensure the proper function and compliant use.  • Provide regular progress updates to manager and present data to internal and external audiences in a succinct and well organized manner.  • Author test methods and development reports.  • Serve as subject matter expert for at least one technical area and train other laboratory personnel on the use and maintenance of equipment.  • Lead technical transfer of assays to and from contract test laboratories or to QC.  • Plan experiments with limited manager oversight and work independently to achieve deliverables with minimal instruction.  • Develop and implement laboratory policies for critical reagents, data management, organizational performance, and continuous improvement.  • Maintain laboratory notebooks and forms consistent with Good Documentation Practices.  • Maintain adequate supplies of laboratory reagents and coordinate biohazard and chemical waste disposal.   Requirements Qualifications  • Solid training in general laboratory practices (e.g., buffer preparation, sample dilution, micro-pipetting).  • Experience in the development and optimization of assays for pharmaceutical characterization.  • Experience in one or more of the following areas, including training and troubleshooting experience:  Chromatography or capillary electrophoresis  Mass spectrometry  Immunochemical assays  Spectroscopy  Cell based assays  • Working knowledge of cGMP practices and ICH guidelines.  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required.  • Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to efficiently function in a team-oriented environment.  • Excellent planning and organizational skills with good documentation, record management habits, and attention to detail.  • Ability to handle multiple projects and to demonstrate initiative and take accountability.  • Flexible and adaptable to meet the needs of the organization.   Preferred Education  • Chemistry or Biological Science degree: bachelors with 8+ years, masters with 6+ years, or doctorate with 2+ years of experience in biopharmaceutical analytical development.  • This is a senior technical position; level is dependent on experience and qualifications.   Preferred Additional Skills (i.e., Computer)  • Proficient with Microsoft-based applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)

description: Sr. Scientist, Pharmacokinetics-PHA001295   Description   Merck & Co., Inc. Kenilworth, N.J., U.S.A. known as Merck in the United States and Canada, is a global health care leader with a diversified portfolio of prescription medicines, vaccines and animal health products. Today, we are building a new kind of healthcare company – one that is ready to help create a healthier future for all of us.   Our ability to excel depends on the integrity, knowledge, imagination, skill, diversity and teamwork of an individual like you. To this end, we strive to create an environment of mutual respect, encouragement and teamwork. As part of our global team, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate with talented and dedicated colleagues while developing and expanding your career.   The Biologics Discovery, DMPK and Disposition function at MRL, Palo Alto focuses strongly on the application of computational biology, systems pharmacology and quantitative principles during the discovery and early development for biologics in an integrated fashion   The position will be a critical member of the function providing strong expertise necessary for development of:   - Drug and combination therapeutic concepts and dose predictions for the design and conduct of preclinical efficacy and nonclinical safety studies  - Application of computational biology and systems pharmacology principles in order to establish and build predictive preclinical drug combination frameworks with application in various therapeutic areas  - Mechanistic approaches (and in an integrated fashion) for integration of key properties such as-- target expression, gene profiles, signaling and pathways, construct properties, disease considerations-- for establishing exposure-response relationships in relevant preclinical studies and assisting in projection of doses in early human clinical studies in support of IND submissions.  - Network analysis and application of bioinformatics principles in data mining and evaluation/interpretation of complex biological systems  - To lead the central core modeling and quantitative function for the department  - To represent the function at the project teams, and collaborate directly and closely with other members of the team and Merck.   Qualifications   Our employees are the key to our company’s success. We demonstrate our commitment to our employees by offering a competitive and valuable rewards program. Our Company’s benefits are designed to support the wide range of goals, needs and lifestyles of our employees, and many of the people that matter the most in their lives. If you need an accommodation for the application process please email us at staffingaadar@merck.com.
