description: Here is a learning environment like no other! At DuPont Industrial Biosciences, we are truly changing the world and having fun doing interesting science. As one of the leading science companies in the world, DuPont Industrial Biosciences offers an informal, highly creative work setting; in which robust team collaboration, open communication, and environmental responsibility are considered company hallmarks. We leverage our cutting-edge biotechnology capabilities to develop sustainable solutions for the emerging bio-based economy.   2016 Summer Internships at DuPont Industrial Biosciences  Palo Alto R&D; Center   DuPont Industrial Biosciences strongly believes in supporting the next generation of scientists and engineers. We’ve developed several opportunities for students to gain the valuable experience they’ll need to succeed in today’s demanding job market. Are you interested in the scientific interfaces between biochemistry, analytical chemistry, fermentation engineering, and microbial physiology leading to performance benefits in real-world industrial applications? We are currently seeking outstanding candidates for 2016 summer internships in our R&D; Center in Palo Alto, California.   The internship project will be an experimental study of hydrolytic enzymes for potential use in industrial applications. The intern will establish and optimize methods for characterizing and screening enzyme performance based on published and internal protocols, including enzymatic activity assays, determination of hydrolysis products by HPLC, evaluating changes in substrate viscosity, etc. Enzymes with interesting attributes may be submitted to application testing for determining industrial relevance. Over the course of the project, the intern will have the opportunity to:  1. gain hands-on experience with enzymatic assays and analytical methods for biomacromolecule detection;  2. make connections between biochemical characterization of enzyme activity/specificity and enzyme performance in real-world applications;  3. learn about industrial biotechnology and work with enzymes relevant to industrial applications. We are looking for candidates who possess a good command of the undergraduate-level biochemistry, including hands-on laboratory experience with proteins and enzyme activity assays, as well as some experience with HPLC and other analytical chemistry techniques.   Job Qualifications Qualified candidates will exhibit the following characteristics:  Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Microbiology, Chemical Engineering or a related field Have completed your sophomore year of undergrad education and will continue your education in the fall Have the ability to work in an interdisciplinary scientific setting High level of initiative and the ability to work in a team environment Exhibit exceptional analytical instrumentation skills Exhibit exceptional bench top analytical skills Ability to document results, analyze data, draw conclusions, and communicate findings Familiarity with theoretical and practical aspects of biochemistry and enzymology Our Palo Alto R&D; Center offers an intensive 13-week science internship program, in which interns develop a science project and take part in a variety of learning activities. You won’t spend your summer in just a single department or lab – DuPont Industrial Biosciences interns get exposure to a broad range of scientific disciplines. At the end of the program you’ll deliver a presentation of your ideas and findings, developing practical real-life skills. Our interns are paid a competitive hourly rate and are responsible for their own housing and transportation for the summer.
jobtitle: Summer Internship: Assessment and evaluation of non-specific hydrolytic enzymes
snippet: DuPont Industrial Biosciences strongly believes in supporting the next generation of scientists and engineers....

description: We are currently seeking a Principal Investigator to join our experienced drug discovery and development team and lead our Cardio-renal Disease Biology effort in Fremont CA. The successful candidate willspearhead the cardio-renal therapeutic strategy and lead drug discovery programs from target identification through IND-enabling studies in a matrixed organization. In support of the company?s drug discovery and development efforts, the Principal Investigator will also directly supervise a group of in vitro biologists focused on the identification and evaluation of new targets, new molecules and mechanisms involved in cardio-renal pathophysiology. Responsibilities ? Reports to the Chief Scientific Officer, has broad responsibility for the metabolic group, including senior scientific contributors, and collaborative activities. ? Responsible for leading the strategy, review, assessment, planning and execution of all activities related to our metabolic drug discovery project portfolio ? Provide a leadership role in developing relevant in vitro biochemical, cell-based and biophysical assays critical to the evaluation of compound activity, as well as assisting in the design of adequate animal models in the field of cardio-renal disorders (e.g. ESRD, CKD, mineral dysregulation, etc.). ? Assist the clinical development team in providing IND-enabling data ? Responsible for tracking group performance and driving continuous improvement. Understand how to organize group efforts, including contracted off-site scientists in order to deliver on goals. ? Ensure budget, timeline, staffing and other corporate/program goals are met ? Provide documented opinion to the executive team on new therapeutic opportunities and serve as the company liaison for collaborations with partners regarding disease area activities. Requirements ? Ph.D. in biology (or a related discipline) with a minimum of 10 years of industrial experience ? A broad knowledge and proven ability to develop in vitro assays and systems for compound evaluation in metabolic disorders (e.g. ESRD, CKD, mineral dysregulation, etc.) and a deep working knowledge of the animal models required to progress candidate molecules. ? Connections with key opinion leaders in fields relevant to the disease area is important ? Experience/knowledge in gut physiology and the role of intestinal receptorItransporters is a plus ? A commitment to high-quality research and the execution of research plans in a timely and organized manner ? Strongwritten and communication skills; and an ability to work effectively with a diverse team of co-workers in a dynamic environment At Ardelyx, you will experience an innovative and dynamic research environment. We are seeking the best in class scientists, advanced thinkers, and people who thrive on collaboration to co-create the future. You will be working with some of the industry's best scientists in a team environment focused on world class research. We offer competitive compensation and benefits and stock options. Ardelyx?, Inc is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

We are currently seeking outstanding candidates for 2016 summer internships in our R&D; Center in Palo Alto, California.   The internship project focuses on regulatory science in support of enzyme safety in human and animal food. Under the mentorship of Regulatory scientists, the intern will contribute to our ‘Generally Recognized As Safe’ (GRAS) program by developing workflow units for product safety and approval dossiers. Examples of these workflow units include toxin sequence database searches, literature reviews of the safety of key enzyme-production organisms, and preparation of safety summaries from toxicology reports. Furthermore, the intern will be involved in drafting enzyme-specific safety papers. description: Position : Senior Research Scientist Location : Milpitas, CA Duration : Full time  Job Description :Business Unit: The Film and Scatterometry Technology (FaST) Division provides industry leading metrology solutions for worldwide semiconductor IC manufacturers. The FaST Division portfolio of metrology products includes hardware and software solutions for optical film thickness, optical critical dimension (CD), composition, and resistivity measurement systems. These products are essential for the IC manufacturers as they provide critical metrology capabilities for the development and implementation of their advanced IC processes. The FaST division is committed to support our customers to achieve performance entitlement of our solution and we effectively partner with our customers from their early research and development phase to the high volume in-line manufacturing implementation specific for their process needs. The division consists of a global team located in US, Israel, China, and India.  Responsibilities: 1) Work within a small group of dedicated individuals to develop and improve an application that is at the core of physical modeling capabilities of a line of semiconductor film measurement systems. 2) Work on problems that influence the design and success of current products or addresses broad design issues of future products or technologies. Tasks include developing problem statements, analysis of various solutions, implementing solutions at software level, testing prototypes, and supporting integration into product software. 3) The responsibilities include development of new numeric methods and algorithms for data processing, physical optical modeling and numeric regression, implementing the algorithms in C++, supporting other groups in adopting new features and participate in troubleshooting.  Preferred Qualifications: 1) Proven ability to solve complex and challenging physics or engineering problems in academic or industrial setting 2) 5+ years of experience in C++ and object oriented design; 3) Ability to work with other scientists and engineers to develop problem statements, requirements and solutions; 4) Experience in any of the following areas: computational physics, scientific programming, numeric methods, algorithm design, and data processing; 5) Background in physical optics or metrology is a plus.  Minimum Qualifications: Doctorate (Academic) Level Degree in Physics, Computational Physics or Applied Mathematics with at least 4 years of experience OR Master's Level Degree with at least 8 years of experience.  Kindly send your resume to  KLA-Tencor is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.
jobtitle: Senior Research Scientist ( C++ | Object Oriented | Algorithms | Mathematics| Computational Physics)

description: Tyco (NYSE: TYC) is the world’s largest pure-play fire and security company. Tyco provides more than three million customers around the globe with the latest fire protection and security products and services. A $10+ billion company, Tyco has more than 57,000 employees in 900 locations in nearly 50 countries serving the world’s most demanding environments, including banking and financial services, oil and gas, marine, government, healthcare, retail, home security, transportation and commercial and industrial. More information on Tyco can be found at www.tyco.com.  Tyco Garage is Tyco’s advanced engineering organization in the globally recognized innovation ecosystems of Silicon Valley, Ca. and Tel Aviv, Israel. We want to fundamentally change how businesses understand and improve their safety, security and operations using technology to deliver actionable learnings and solve very interesting, real world problems.  We are a start-up like in-house innovation hub with some very smart people that are helping to lead Tyco to the forefront of sensor-based analytics and helping fulfill Tyco’s mission of zero harm to people and environment). We work in small, fast teams that drive efficient development cycles delivering iterative output and results in speedy sprints. We lead interaction and collaborations with internal and external partners and stakeholders  If you are driven by a strong sense of curiosity, urgency and passion, excited by the combination of a can do startup culture and the customer base and stability of an established company, then Tyco Garage is right for you.  Job Description  This role will lead a series of exciting new embedded vision projects in Tyco’s Advanced Engineering Center in Silicon Valley. The success in this role requires the ownership of a significant new work-stream in the team focused on solving complex computer vision problems (including, but not limited to, image representation, object recognition, and caption generation), using machine learning (particularly, deep learning methods such as convolutional neural networks) and high-performance computing (including, near real-time image analysis).   Employ the best of computer-vision research for solving problems and disrupting the current practice in face and gesture recognition, situational awareness and 3D mapping. Build and refine computer vision and machine learning algorithms that can find patterns in large multi-modal data (particularly, images and videos) Work closely with a team to develop operational prototype systems and investigate their deployment to challenging, real-world problems. Seek, develop and champion new business opportunities based around the technical capabilities of the group. Work with internal and external stakeholders to develop solutions to their requirements leveraging computer vision and machine learning capabilities. Comfort with a high degree of ambiguity and ability to solve problems that haven’t been solved to scale before are essential. Collaborate with software and hardware development teams to build robust vision-based solutions for customer-facing applications. Communicate (both oral and written) with colleagues and stakeholders (both internal and external) Review, direct, guide, inspire the research of more junior scientists in the team Above all, this role will provide a unique opportunity to enjoy state-of-the-art research and development; grow and be challenged in an entrepreneurial / start-up-like division of a large company; and create game-changing products for the security and retail markets.  Qualifications  Experience   Embedded Vision Systems – imagers, video and signal processing and analytics, object detection and recognition, event and activity recognition, content based search and retrieval, data mining, knowledge based inferencing and machine learning. Strong background in basic machine learning and statistical modeling related to embedded vision (e.g., classification, regression, and clustering including topics such as graph theory, hierarchical modeling, and Bayesian inference) and track record in integrating machine learning with real-time computing Prefer expertise and real-world experience in deep learning (convolutional neural networks, restricted Boltzmann machines, and deep neural networks). Experience in employing machine learning in a commercial/business setting – in collaboration with product (back-end and front-end) development teams.  Qualifications   PhD or Masters in the field of computer vision, image and video processing, machine learning (or related field) 5+ years of experience and a track record of successful applications of embedded vision technologies, creating novel algorithms and developing practical solutions to complex problems. Strong communication and collaboration skills Proficiency in signal processing and some of the programming languages such as C/C++, python, R, Java and/or matlab  Job  :  Engineering  Organization  :  Tyco HQ - Enterprise Software  Primary Location  :  United States-California-San Jose  Job Posting  :  Mar 8, 2016, 2:58:48 PM  Shift  :  Day Job  EEO/AA/Female/Minority/Veteran/Disability Employer
jobtitle: Sr. Software Engineer-Computer Vision, Tyco Technology and Innovation (California)

description: Jazz Pharmaceuticals is seeking a clinical scientist to join a development team in central nervous system drug development. You will be responsible for assisting senior clinical development staff in the preparation and review of clinical documents and conducting research and developing presentations. You will interact with multidisciplinary groups across the company including biostatistics, clinical operations, regulatory, product development, quality and business development and working most closely with clinical development, operations, biostatistics and regulatory groups.   Essential Functions  • Read and interpret scientific and medical literature for the use in clinical documents and to assist clinical team decision making.  • Develop phase II -IV clinical protocols as part of a clinical development team.  • Prepare clinical portions of all relevant regulatory filings (IND, NDA, etc)  • Identify clinical investigators and coordinates their activities for the conduct of clinical trials and advisory board meetings.  • Work closely with other functional areas within the Research and Development Departments (clinical operations, data management, biostatistics, clinical pharmacology, preclinical) to facilitate the execution of clinical trials  • Prepare clinical data and clinical program presentations  • Supervise for the generation of clinical study report sections as requested by Medical Writing  • Assess accuracy of clinical data in clinical documents  • Represent the company at scientific and industry community meetings, as needed   Requirements Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities  • 2+ years of corporate, government or academic pharmaceutical development experience preferred  • 2+ years of experience in scientific research is required, with CNS or Sleep Medicine expertise preferred  • Outstanding teamwork, presentation, written and oral skills required  • Excellent WORD, EXCEL and POWERPOINT skills  • Collaborative and flexible in personal interactions at all levels of the company  • Proven ability to work independently, proactively and effectively  • Proven strategic planning, organizational and communication skills  • Travel required (up to 5 - 20% of time)  Required/Preferred Education and Licenses  • PhD, PharmD, or other advanced scientific or clinical degrees considered.  Description of Physical Demands  • Occasional mobility within office environment.  • Routinely sitting for extended periods of time.  • Constantly operating a computer, printer, telephone and other similar office machinery.  Description of Work Environment  • Work indoors in normal office environment with little exposure to excessive noise, dust, fumes, vibrations and temperature changes.  • Frequent computer use at workstation.  • May move from one work location to another occasionally.  • Responsibilities may require a work schedule that may include working outside of “normal” work hours, in order to meet business demands.  • Occasional public contact requiring appropriate business apparel.   Jazz Pharmaceuticals is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any characteristic protected by law.   Apply Here: http://www.Click2Apply.net/bdvwgfpkvj   PI93182233

Preferred Qualifications: 1) Proven ability to solve complex and challenging physics or engineering problems in academic or industrial setting 2) 5+ years of experience in C++ and object oriented design; 3) Ability to work with other scientists and engineers to develop problem statements, requirements and solutions; 4) Experience in any of the following areas: computational physics, scientific programming, numeric methods, algorithm design, and data processing; 5) Background in physical optics or metrology is a plus.  Minimum Qualifications: Doctorate (Academic) Level Degree in Physics, Computational Physics or Applied Mathematics with at least 4 years of experience OR Master's Level Degree with at least 8 years of experience. description: Here is a learning environment like no other! At DuPont Industrial Biosciences, we are truly changing the world and having fun doing interesting science. As one of the leading science companies in the world, DuPont Industrial Biosciences offers an informal, highly creative work setting; in which robust team collaboration, open communication, and environmental responsibility are considered company hallmarks. We leverage our cutting-edge biotechnology capabilities to develop sustainable solutions for the emerging bio-based economy.   2016 Summer Internships at DuPont Industrial Biosciences  Palo Alto R&D; Center   DuPont Industrial Biosciences strongly believes in supporting the next generation of scientists and engineers. We’ve developed several opportunities for students to gain the valuable experience they’ll need to succeed in today’s demanding job market. Are you interested in the scientific interfaces between biochemistry, analytical chemistry, fermentation engineering, and microbial physiology leading to performance benefits in real-world industrial applications? We are currently seeking outstanding candidates for 2016 summer internships in our R&D; Center in Palo Alto, California.   The internship will be focused on metabolic analysis of microbial mutants with altered amino acid biosynthetic pathways. We are seeking a summer intern with interest in microbial physiology, cell metabolism, and metabolic pathway engineering. Some experience in analytical chemistry and mass spectrometry is highly desirable.   Job Qualifications Qualified candidates will exhibit the following characteristics:  Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Biochemistry, Microbiology, Chemical Engineering or a related field Have completed your sophomore year of undergrad education and will continue your education in the fall Have the ability to work in an interdisciplinary scientific setting High level of initiative and the ability to work in a team environment Exhibit exceptional analytical instrumentation skills Exhibit exceptional bench top analytical skills Ability to document results, analyze data, draw conclusions, and communicate findings Familiarity with theoretical and practical aspects of biochemistry and enzymology Our Palo Alto R&D; Center offers an intensive 13-week science internship program, in which interns develop a science project and take part in a variety of learning activities. You won’t spend your summer in just a single department or lab – DuPont Industrial Biosciences interns get exposure to a broad range of scientific disciplines. At the end of the program you’ll deliver a presentation of your ideas and findings, developing practical real-life skills. Our interns are paid a competitive hourly rate and are responsible for their own housing and transportation for the summer.
jobtitle: Summer Internship: Metabolomics analysis of Bacillus strains with an altered amino acid biosynthesis pathway

We are currently seeking outstanding candidates for 2016 summer internships in our R&D; Center in Palo Alto, California.   The internship will study expression of genes of interest in Bacillus to assess growth and production under extreme conditions. The intern will learn to express typical Bacilli genes of interest, test various fermentation processes, and prove feasibility of an expression system with versatility in fermentations, and production of industrial products. The project will involve the use of genetic engineering techniques such as bacterial transformation, genomic and plasmid DNA isolation, phenotypic and microscopic observation. Molecular biology and biochemistry methods such as PCR amplification, DNA cloning, Gene assembly as well as protein analysis will be applied. We're looking for a creative, self-motivated student with interest in one or more of the areas of molecular biology, microbiology, biochemistry, fermentation or closely related fields. The intern will learn how to communicate and interact in a professional environment. A good amount of courage and willingness to try out new things is will be beneficial. description: Job Description :Business Unit: The Film and Scatterometry Technology (FaST) Division of KLA-Tencor provides industry leading metrology solutions for worldwide semiconductor IC manufacturers. The FaST Division portfolio of metrology products includes hardware and software solutions for optical film thickness, optical critical dimension (CD), composition, and resistivity measurement systems. These products are essential for the IC manufacturers as they provide critical metrology capabilities for the development and implementation of their advanced IC processes. The FaST division is committed to support our customers to achieve performance entitlement of our solution and we effectively partner with our customers from their early research and development phase to the high volume in-line manufacturing implementation specific for their process needs. The division consists of a global team located in US, Israel, China, and India.  Responsibilities: 1) Work within a small group of dedicated individuals to develop and improve an application that is at the core of physical modeling capabilities of a line of semiconductor film measurement systems. 2) Works on problems that impact the design success of current products or addresses broad design issues of future products or technologies. 3) Tasks include developing problem statements, analysis of various solutions, implementing solutions at software level, testing prototypes, and supporting integration into tool product software. 4) This position is focusing on user features, data presentation and visualization and integration with tool product software, with opportunities for developing new algorithms and modeling capabilities.  Preferred Qualifications: a) 5+ years of experience in C++ and object oriented design; b) Good understanding of the basic principles of multi-threaded programming and GUI design; c) Ability to work with other scientists and engineers to develop problem statements, requirements and solutions; d) Experience in any of the following areas: computational physics, scientific programming, data processing, scientific data presentation/visualization, numeric methods, and statistical analysis.  Minimum Qualifications: Doctorate (Academic) Level Degree in Physics, Computational Physics, Computer Science or Applied Mathematics with at least 2 years of experience OR Master's Level Degree with at least 5 years of experience, or Bachelor's Level Degree with at least 8 years of experience. Kindly send your resume to

description: Microcode engineers at Ambarella are responsible for the design, development and implementation of advanced imaging and video algorithms across our line of proprietary SoCs. As a member of our team, you will be working with industry-recognized scientists and architects to bring our superior video quality to a variety of camera markets including sports, wearable, IP-security and more.  For this position, we are seeking a talented engineer with a particular interest in the IP-security camera market, a domain with complex video and image quality requirements.  Responsibilities: Develop a deep understanding of Ambarellaâ??s DSP architecture to ensure the efficient use of hardware resources such as CPU cycles and memory during code development. These resources are critical to scaling imaging algorithms to various scenarios and resolutions (e.g., 4K). Review feature requests with the application and system teams. Design and develop microcode within the boundaries defined by the relevant algorithm and DSP. Understand features from a customer point-of-view and propose well thought-out APIs to cover all possible corner-case scenarios. Debug low-level software in various environments such as a pre-silicon simulation model, during silicon bring-up, as well as during the production phase. Develop and debug software in a test environment to verify the performance of various functional areas of the microcode, such as CFA, filters, video CODECs, and more. Drive development activities in pre- and post-silicon environments.  Requirements: A Bachelorâ??s degree in EE, computer engineering, CS or equivalent. A masterâ??s degree in one of these disciplines is preferred. 3+ years of experience developing in C. 1+ year experience with assembly code development and debugging. Solid knowledge of scripting languages such as Perl. 1+ year experience with computer architecture including registers, interrupts, threads, on-chip memory and DRAM. Must be able to resolve data synchronization issues with computer architecture. Must be comfortable with modern software development methodologies such as code review, unit testing, peer reviews, and more. Familiarity with image processing and video compression standards (e.g., MPEG, H.264/265). Must have basic knowledge of video representation. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Excellent analytical, problem solving and presentation skills. Excellent cross-functional, cross-site teamwork abilities.  VentureLoop: Connect with Startups. Get in the Loop.
